Sandra discovers the most vocal member of the gang is the niece of a political activist who went missing 25 years previously after waging a campaign against the comedian. Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. Guest starring Phil Daniels, Joe Absolom and John Henshaw

programme.title: Cutting It
programme.desc: Eight months after the Henshall salon went up in smoke, the family prepare to reopen their business once more. But Allie and Ruby have more pressing concerns - they are both heavily pregnant by the same man. Sarah Parish and Lucy Gaskell star

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Part one of two. Detectives arrive at Larkhall to investigate Jim Fenner's death and find the finger of suspicion pointing firmly at his wife Di - though they soon realise looking for a murderer in a prison is like searching for a needle in a haystack. Routines seem set to change with the appointment of a tough new wing governor, and Sheena prepares to leave her cell behind, though she's not so keen on saying goodbye to Pat. Tony Slattery guest stars

programme.title: Lovejoy

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers work in pairs to transform three independent shops in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, on a budget of £3,000 in just two days. Ry and Jack struggle to relate to the clientele of the shoe shop they're designing and Alan wonders if Ry has lost his mojo. Tom and Temi are paired together to transform the Sheepskin shop, but a disagreement over colour schemes could derail their design before it has even been made. Monika and Peter get to work on a minimalist but functional scheme for a fashion store but Monika worries she has bitten off more than she can chew

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The second leg of their trip takes Anton and Giovanni to Mount Etna, Europe's highest and most active volcano. Along the way Giovanni takes Anton to a traditional Sicilian barber to get beach ready before trying paddleboarding in the Ionian Sea. When they reach the volcano, the pair hike halfway to the summit with some help from some unexpected furry friends before deciding to camp overnight. A surprise visit from 2021 Strictly champion Rose Ayling-Ellis wakes them up and they complete their trek in style by taking to the skies and flying over the crater in a helicopter

Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani

programme.desc: Lola is overwhelmed by her family's unwavering support. Rocky enlists Sonia, Reiss and Harvey's help to find his wife but it's Freddie that manages to track her down and give her Kathy's address

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a military bugle for veteran Billy. The instrument once belonged to Billy's great-grandfather and has definitely seen better days. It is now in use at a blind veteran's rehabilitation centre in Llandudno and he's hoping the barn's musical-maestro Pete Woods can bring it back to its former glory. Mark Stuckey is faced with the task of repairing a portable radio that once filled hairdresser Karl's grandfather's salons with musical memories. Charlotte brings in a replica model of Big Ben made almost entirely from matchsticks. The model, measuring just over 5ft, has been handed through generations of Charlotte's family after being built in 1953 to commemorate Queen Elizabeth's coronation and is looking a little worse for ware. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland repairs a pair of children's shoes that are over 75 years old, having been given to 83 year-old Nechama when her family fled Eastern Europe in the 1930's as Hitler rose to power

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The competitors leave the indigenous island of Haida Gwaii and embark on a 2,000 kilometre journey north to the second checkpoint, Dawson City. Claudia and Kevin are the first to leave with a two minute advantage on the rest, Tricia and Cathie set off with different priorities and Zainib and Mobeen continue to rely on the kindness of strangers. Monique's education continues along the journey making father Ladi hopeful and Marc and Michael have a spat over Marc's fear of bears

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Twenty-three year-old Chiedza converted to Islam three years ago. Now, she is trying to find a husband and has decided to follow traditional and modern Muslim dating rules. She tries a marriage introduction day at a mosque, a Muslim-only dating app and a live dating event with a difference. Will she find love? And will her mother approve?

There's little for detectives to go on after a man is left to die in the street and when the attacker strikes again they are in a race against time to find the person responsible. Plus, a fingerprint found on the number plate of the getaway car used in the armed robbery of a neighbourhood pub leads officers to their suspect

programme.desc: The keepers have a challenge on their hands when two-year-old porcupine Spud goes missing. How do you find an escaped animal, amongst a million trees, that's perfectly camouflaged? Elsewhere, the future for one of the legends of the park, Dave the wolf, hangs in the balance. Everything points to an infection, but initial medication doesn't seem to be working. Presented by Ben Fogle and Kate Humble

While shopping in Shropshire is considered successful, the duo's plan to spend the night in the great outdoors proves disastrous

A surgeon-turned-inventor thinks he's solved a universal problem for parents, while low strength gin gets tastebuds tingling. A Norwich-based couple pitch their children's storage baskets with a twist, and an entrepreneur is on a mission to eliminate the dreaded sweat patch. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - £150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part two of two. Liz Bonnin joins the palaeontologists as they unearth the remains of fearsome Jurassic predators, with the team considering if the site was a dinosaur hunting ground. They try to figure out if these predators were involved in the deaths of supersized beasts like the diplodocus buried at the site, helping to reveal why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: Lifeline

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Short
programme.desc: The food enthusiasts cook traditional pasties at Geevor Tin Mine in Cornwall, then head northwards to Melton Mowbray, where they try their hand at making pork pies. The duo's trip ends on the banks of the River Deveron in Scotland, where they cook salmon coulibiac - a whole fish stuffed with prawns wrapped in filo pastry - for Highland dancers and pipers

programme.title: Celebrity Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup presents the second round, which sees Jane Seymour, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Phil Tufnell, Amber Le Bon, Josie D'Arby and George Shelley tackle landscapes. However, for their first task they have to put down their paint brushes and dabble in the digital world instead, a medium not all the VIPs are comfortable with using. They are soon back on more familiar ground as they paint a cityscape of London, with comic Russell Kane popping by to help judge the results

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and the team are in Devon to help Faith create a unique B&B with a celestial theme as a tribute to her late father

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin head to Norway to discover four extraordinary homes in a country where architecture is influenced by incredible landscapes and the extreme climate. Properties include Vega Cottage, on Vega Island, 600km north of Oslo near the Arctic Circle, a truly remote family retreat delicately perched on rocks and overlooking the beach

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The experts assess items brought to the Blickling estate in Norfolk, and Paul Martin learns about Lord Lothian's key role in getting America involved in the Second World War

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Lucy Beaumont, Shazia Mirza, Joe Thomas and Jake Wood test their general knowledge skills in the hope of winning a prize

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Edith Bowman takes Colin Murray on a food adventure in her home town of Anstruther. As well as its famous fish and chips, they discover how artisan bread is being made for the community. Briony May Williams bags bargains hunting for yellow stickers in the supermarket, Suzie Lee reveals how Greek-style yoghurt is made in Co Down and Onkar Singh Purewal discovers Swansea's community garden produce

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Jacqueline and her husband Alex were about to remodel their two-bed London terrace, but tragically, Alex fell ill and died. Three years since his death, Jacqueline has resolved to finish what they started, supported by her 22-year-old son Jamie. Jacqueline and Jamie share the family home, but both long for some privacy. However, the problem is that the terrace has just one reception room on the ground floor. Jacqueline and Jamie are handing over control to competing architects Lizzie Fraher and Julian McIntosh. Lizzie has plenty of experience in unlocking the possibilities in residential projects, while Julian loves the creative challenge inherent in modest budgets. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight regional champions cook their fish courses to win a place on the menu of a banquet celebrating animation and illustration. Guest judging is animator and co-founder of Aardman Animations, Peter Lord OBE, who joins the panel of food critics - Michelin-starred chef Tom Kerridge, restaurateur Nisha Katona and food podcast host and comedian Ed Gamble - as they choose the banquet's fish course

programme.title: Murder in Mayfair
programme.desc: Reporter Nawal Al-Maghafi investigates the murder of Norwegian student Martine Vik Magnussen in 2008, who was killed in a flat near Mayfair after a night out. Al-Maghafi seeks answers from the only suspect, Farouk Abdulhak, the son of a Yemeni billionaire who, hours after Magnussen's death fled the UK to Yemen, and uncovering how money, political power and Yemeni law protected Farouk once he absconded to Yemen, which has no extradition treaty with the UK

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Darren Harriott hosts the show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing stand-up performances by Jessica Fostekew and Stephen Bailey

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Inside Taiwan: Standing up to China
programme.desc: Jane Corbin travels to Taiwan to take viewers inside a story that has ramifications for all of us. In the process, she reveals China's 'playbook' as its desire to 'reunify the motherland' becomes ever clearer, and it could drag the world into a dangerous confrontation

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by TV presenter and actress Mel Giedroyc, comedian Sophie Duker, chef Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and actor Nigel Havers, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are Weyward by Emilia Hart, and Death and the Penguin by Andrey Kurkov

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by rail through Queensland from Kuranda to Townsville, marvelling at the engineering expertise of a railway line built in the 1890s. He also visits a plantation where he learns how to harvest sugar cane and ventures into the hinterland, where he braves a crocodile safari

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford report on the double booking nightmare that put a real dampener on the holidays of two families. Plus, the driver whose whose car was left damaged by an airport meet-and-greet service

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Digital embroider David is hoping Dom Chinea can help him find the success his pieces deserve. Novice woodworker Rachael is hoping to find the path to success

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr transform the courtyard into a Mediterranean oasis. To brush up on their botany, the pair visit the magnificent gardens of one of Sicily's biggest wine producers, where they help out with the grape harvest. Keen to create an authentic Sicilian design, Alan explores Sciacca's famous ceramic scene and gets arty painting Moor Heads. He also enlists the help of two baroque-style painters to bring a touch of the island's rich history with a surprise courtyard centrepiece. Amanda repairs the old courtyard walls, which turns out to be a far bigger job than anticipated

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.desc: JB Gill journeys along a 12-mile stretch of the River Severn in Shropshire to discover the ways civilisations have lived and worshipped along its banks since the dawn of man. Starting in the shadow of Ironbridge, he finds out how the family that constructed the bridge and kick-started the Industrial Revolution were guided by their Quaker faith. After a spot of coracling on the water, he stops at the ruins of Buildwas Abbey and meets a modern-day monk to find out how their penitent lifestyles have changed since the structure was in its prime. Later, JB visits the ruins of the Roman city of Wroxeter, before lending a hand at a local vineyard

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A fingerprint left behind at an old break-in solves a murder at the same factory months later. A DNA spray means police can finally apprehend a prolific motorbike thief

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: Cafe owner and opera singer Rhona takes the other hikers on a 7km coastal walk around Skye, from Waterloo to Ashaig, across marshland and rivers

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: The Critical Care team help a Tawny Owl who was found on the roadside while Orthopaedic surgeon 'Magic' gives Alfie the Shih Tzu a hip replacement. The team try to find the owners of a lost Dachshund puppy but when the microchip provides no help, they turn to social media

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Dave takes Si on a pub tour of the Lake District, following in the footsteps of the poets Wordsworth and Coleridge. They sample negus, a wine-based drink from the late 1800s, and take part in a traditional pub competition to find out who is 'The Biggest Liar'

programme.title: Celebrity Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup presents the semi-final and the six celebrities are keen to create their best work to date to claim the last three spots on the gallery wall. What's more, at the end of the show, the judges will be choosing the three best to go through to next week's final, so the pressure is on as they take on the tricky genre of movement. For the warm-up, they are joined by a few farmyard friends, before the all-important main challenge brings them face to face with Joey - puppet star of the stage show War Horse - who they have to capture on canvas in all his articulated glory

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon and the team tackle a traditional 'Cob' house built from mud in an Oxfordshire back garden for a school project and turn into a unusual B&B

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin head to Israel, where they discover four extraordinary homes, designed to combat the heat and inspired by rich cultural and historical traditions. Among the properties are Barud House in Jerusalem, made from 50,000 white stone tiles, arranged into a symmetrical pattern that casts shadows across the house all day. The final stop is the village of Musmus and the House of Three Gardens, where Tel Aviv architect Ron Fleisher has designed a house that combines traditional Islamic architecture with modernism

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At Oxburgh Hall in Norfolk, David Harper is excited by a Polynesian war club, while Philip Serrell falls for a sewing machine dating back to 1875. Presenter Paul Martin uncovers the history of the Bedingfeld family, whose members have called Oxburgh home for 500 years - and managed to keep their heads on their shoulders

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Lucy Beaumont, Shazia Mirza, Joe Thomas and Jake Wood test their general knowledge skills in the hope of winning a prize

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman explore St George's Market in Belfast and meet a social media sensation who reveals the secrets of healthy and inexpensive one-pot meals. Farmer Jim Smith discovers how one farm is turning its oats into milk, and food journalist Leyla Kazim is in Norfolk to find out the secrets of producing mustard, while farmer Meinir Howells reveals just why Welsh lamb is so popular

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Six years ago, Victoria and Raheel snapped up an impressive four-bedroom 1990s build in Milton Keynes, but after years of trying to make the space work for their growing family, they are now desperate to find a solution. Using virtual reality, architects Damion Burrows and Will Foster compete against each other to come up with a design that will suit this family's needs. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Eight regional champions cook their main courses in a bid to secure a place on the menu of a banquet celebrating animation and illustration. Sir Lenny Henry is guest judge. The standards are at an all-time high, with dishes celebrating Ratty's picnic in Wind in the Willows, Quentin Blake's recipe illustrations of a savoury crocodile, and comic book hero Desperate Dan and his cow pie

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Cardiac surgeon Betsy Evans operates on her longest-waiting patient, Andy, who has a hereditary heart condition and needs an urgent triple bypass. A lack of intensive care beds for after-surgery means he has been waiting on the ward for four weeks and, as he also has bipolar disorder, every day spent waiting has been a challenge for his mental health. Professor Simon Kay aims to perform hand surgery on a teenage patient whose fingers are bent inwards, having been born with a rare and incurable joint condition called arthrogryposis

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Saturday finds everyone visiting Aunty Rose in the nursing home so she can give Simon a somewhat unorthodox birthday present, while Simon and Donna reluctantly join the family to see Alan Titchmarsh's new house. Later, on a cliff top walk, David updates the family on his disastrous love life, and Sue confides in Simon that they're thinking of moving as the house is feeling too big. Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Great Gatsby (2000)
programme.desc: A poor soldier leaves the love of his life to make his fortune overseas, but on his return is devastated to learn she has married a cruel, uncaring man. Throwing caution to the wind, he uses his newly acquired wealth and position in society to romance her - leading to tragedy for all concerned. Drama based on F Scott Fitzgerald's classic novel, starring Mira Sorvino, Toby Stephens, Paul Rudd and Martin Donovan

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford report on the disruptive passengers whose drunken behaviour caused problems for all their fellow travellers. Plus, how a whole holiday can be ruined when even the smallest parts of the trip go wrong

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea gives glass-blower Mark from north Wales and potter Victor from London the opportunity to turn their hobbies into money-making businesses. After being exposed to lead poisoning as a child Mark gave up his hobby of glass-blowing and spent 35 years working in the voluntary sector but when we was made redundant, Mark put his savings into setting up his own studio and getting back into glass-blowing. Victor was introduced to pottery by an art therapist during treatment for his anxiety. His clay sculptures have artistic flair but when he adds flourishes to his tableware it takes too long to make them profitable. The pair have two months to prove they have the skill and ambition to make it at market

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A collection of beautiful Middle Eastern fabrics and some vintage game consoles are among today's transformations. Hosted by Sabrina Grant

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple from the largest town in Dorset to move to rural Devon, and learns the importance of local newspapers in keeping communities connected and informed

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Police find the names of an international drug network in a hotel guest book plus thieves who stole £20,000 worth of food are caught out by a car number plate

programme.title: Paul Whitehouse: Our Troubled Rivers
programme.desc: Part one of two. The actor, writer and comedian travels around England and Wales looking at the issues that their rivers and waterways are facing. He begins by visiting the north of England to find out the impact water companies have on rivers, exploring the change in the industry since privatisation in 1989 and what regulations are in place when it comes to sewage discharge. He meets concerned locals looking to highlight the health of the River Wharfe, a conservationist who warns of the ecological decline in iconic Lake Windemere, and singer Feargal Sharkey, who has become a figurehead for the campaign to prevent water companies dumping sewage into UK waterways and seas

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si and Dave take a Manchester pub crawl to uncover historic establishments once at the heart of the city's industrial revolution. Starting in Middleton, they discover that politics, protest and plotting were rife in a pub's back rooms in the early 1800s, before visiting a local brewery to find out more about the popularity of beer in Britain

programme.title: Celebrity Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup presents the final, which sees the best three contestants putting everything they have learned into practice. First they must capture the sensuality and movement of the Argentine tango on canvas, as performed by former Strictly Come Dancing professionals Flavia Cacace and Vincent Simone. Then they paint through the night at the Natural History Museum - and for the first time they can choose the subject matter from the museum's millions of items. There follows a charity auction where all six contestants put their favourite artworks up for sale, before the winner's name is announced

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Master craftsman Simon Parfett and his team are in Warwickshire to turn a 200-year-old turret into a medieval-themed B&B. The tiny two-floored building may look like a turret on the outside, but on the inside it's a bland office and storage space that couldn't be less regal

programme.title: Grizzly Bear Cubs and Me
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Buchanan joins the Pazhetnovs, a pioneering family of biologists in Russia as they attempt to rehab grizzly bear cub orphans. There are more than 100,000 grizzlies in Russia and as humans encroach further into this vast wilderness, conflict is increasing. The Pazhetnovs have been rescuing orphaned cubs for nearly three decades and have successfully returned more than 200 of them back to the wild. Gordon arrives in February when six cubs have just been rescued. They are just five weeks old and each weigh less than a bag of sugar

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Five experts assess items brought to the Blickling estate in Norfolk, with David Harper excited by an early device for watching films, while David Fletcher and James Lewis reminisce about Rupert the Bear books and Dinky toys. Paul Martin enjoys a ride in a tank on historic former military camp

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Lucy Beaumont, Shazia Mirza, Joe Thomas and Jake Wood test their general knowledge skills in the hope of winning a prize

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the annual Neath Food and Drink Festival and finds out whether traditional or gourmet Welsh cakes are more popular among the visitors. Food journalist Leyla Kazim reveals the secrets of growing tomatoes on a large or small scale farmer Jim Smith gets stuck into making marmalade and Ryan Hand tries an experiment to find out whether there is such a thing as brain food

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Hemal and Kapila have wrestled with how to improve their four-bedroom family home and make the space work better for them and their three children, but their ideas for a project have not moved forward. Now, architects Will Foster and Lizzie Fraher compete using virtual reality to win the opportunity to remodel the property. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight regional champions cook their desserts in a bid to secure the last place on the menu at the banquet. Morwenna Banks, voice of Mummy Pig on Peppa Pig, is the guest judge

programme.title: Get on Up: The Triumph of Black America
programme.desc: Actor David Harewood travels across the US to discover the stories behind his artistic heroes from the 1960s to the 1990s. Along the way he discovers how these African-American performers, film-makers and writers have come to transform popular culture around the world

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back at some of the news of the week, with guests James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne and Nish Kumar

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Murder in Mayfair
programme.desc: Reporter Nawal Al-Maghafi investigates the murder of Norwegian student Martine Vik Magnussen in 2008, who was killed in a flat near Mayfair after a night out. Al-Maghafi seeks answers from the only suspect, Farouk Abdulhak, the son of a Yemeni billionaire who, hours after Magnussen's death fled the UK to Yemen, and uncovering how money, political power and Yemeni law protected Farouk once he absconded to Yemen, which has no extradition treaty with the UK

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Cardiac surgeon Betsy Evans operates on her longest-waiting patient, Andy, who has a hereditary heart condition and needs an urgent triple bypass. A lack of intensive care beds for after-surgery means he has been waiting on the ward for four weeks and, as he also has bipolar disorder, every day spent waiting has been a challenge for his mental health. Professor Simon Kay aims to perform hand surgery on a teenage patient whose fingers are bent inwards, having been born with a rare and incurable joint condition called arthrogryposis

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Single mother Amy is desperate to learn to drive to improve the lives of her kids. But after 13 years learning and two failed tests under the instruction of her own mother, both feel they are going backwards. During five days, they must try and stop Amy's panic attacks while driving

programme.title: Inside Our Autistic Minds
programme.desc: The second of two documentaries in which Chris Packham helps people on the autism spectrum create short films that reveal what is really going on inside their minds. He meets Anton, a teaching assistant and trance DJ with a deep love of Middlesbrough FC, and Ethan, a 19-year-old student and aspiring rapper from Essex. He helps them make films to reveal to their friends and classmates how they feel about change and hypersensitivity to noise respectively

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A vintage sewing table with great sentimental value, an old family tent and a martial arts expert's karate belts are among the transformations by the team of skilled craftspeople. Sabrina Grant hosts

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's journey through eastern England takes him to the Snape Maltings music and arts venue, the Norfolk seaside resort of Great Yarmouth and the city of Norwich

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming battles his way through blanket weed on the Shropshire Union Canal, before accidentally flooding a staircase lock in Chester

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel finishes his book and submits it to Alistair - who decides it needs a picture of the author on the cover. Unfortunately, choosing a suitable image proves troublesome. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: Helen finds out about Maxine, but takes the whole thing in her stride. Conclusion of Carla Lane's love triangle comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Peter McEnery and Jane Asher. From 1987

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama continues his narrative with a look at why Britain proved immune to the ideals of the French Revolution, ignoring the call of liberty, equality and fraternity so readily embraced by the peasantry of France. Instead, the influence of poets, painters and journalists of the Romantic movement persuaded the nation of the primacy of feeling over reason, and divided opinion on the civil strife across the Channel

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: The scientific story behind the moment the first stars appeared in the universe, known as the Cosmic Dawn, which transformed the dark world originally created by the Big Bang. Astronomers now have the tools to explore this dramatic event that created the first ingredients of life as we know it, when the first stars were born to light up the universe. With contributions by Professor Tom Abel, Professor Volker Bromm, Charmaine Green and Margaret Whitehurst

programme.title: Restoring the Earth: The Age of Nature
programme.desc: Documentary series about nature's resilience, and how ecosystems devastated by human impact can be revived and become sustainable for future generations

programme.title: A Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Nature intervenes as comedian Griff Rhys Jones continues in his attempts to restore his 200-year-old farmhouse in Pembrokeshire

programme.title: How to Make
programme.desc: Designer Zoe Laughlin examines the toothbrush, an item so ubiquitous that most people do not give it a moment's thought - and yet 200 million of them are thrown away each year. Zoe sets out to create a sustainable solution, heading to a low-impact factory in Sweden where handles are made from sugarcane bio-based plastic and exploring bespoke production techniques employing 3D laser sintering

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's journey through eastern England takes him to the Snape Maltings music and arts venue, the Norfolk seaside resort of Great Yarmouth and the city of Norwich

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming battles his way through blanket weed on the Shropshire Union Canal, before accidentally flooding a staircase lock in Chester

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Simon Schama continues his narrative with a look at why Britain proved immune to the ideals of the French Revolution, ignoring the call of liberty, equality and fraternity so readily embraced by the peasantry of France. Instead, the influence of poets, painters and journalists of the Romantic movement persuaded the nation of the primacy of feeling over reason, and divided opinion on the civil strife across the Channel

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo completes his rail journey through 1930s Britain, beginning in Norfolk at the headquarters of an international horse welfare organisation. In Peterborough, he visits a tidal defence barrier that helped save the city from flooding, while in Lincolnshire crosses the point at which the Mallard broke the speed record for a steam-powered locomotive in 1938. After a spell in the coastal town of Skegness, Michael's journey ends at RAF Coningsby where he sees some iconic Second World War aircraft, before witnessing a dazzling display featuring the RAF's latest combat aircraft

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming gets stuck in the mud in Woodseaves Cutting, and explores the charming canal-side village of Kinver in Staffordshire

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Chris Packham shines a light on some of the species that show how brainpower, ingenuity and clever tactics are just as important as brawn in the daily battle for survival. Spotted hyenas play politics to gain power, and the female with the most friends rules their group, while being a team player can help when it comes to getting a meal - as demonstrated by vampire bats, who share mouthfuls of blood with strangers in the hope of building a bond and receiving the favour in return

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: Vanessa Collingridge examines the life of Elizabeth Tudor, with a focus on how documentary TV and the BBC have looked at her legacy and interrogated her reign. Using archive stretching back over 60 years, her upbringing, her conflicts with enemies including Mary Queen of Scots, and her greatest victory against the Spanish Armada are investigated. The programme seeks to understand how the monarch created a legacy that people still live with today, and how it has changed throughout the centuries

programme.title: Glenda Jackson Remembers...Elizabeth R
programme.desc: Double-Oscar winner Glenda Jackson remembers the role that brought her back to television after the huge success she had found on the big screen - Queen Elizabeth I in the BBC's acclaimed six-part 1971 series 'Elizabeth R'. She recalls how she came to have huge admiration for the real-life Elizabeth, discovering so much more about her life and loves as she prepared to take on the role, and describes the challenges faced when making an epic drama

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc: Award-winning drama series chronicling the life of Queen Elizabeth I, beginning with the 10-year period preceding her accession to the throne at the age of 25. Starring Glenda Jackson, Ronald Hines, Daphne Slater, Rachel Kempson, Bernard Hepton and Peter Jeffrey

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc: The new Queen finds herself pressured by Parliament to marry and produce an heir. Second part of the award-winning period drama chronicling the life of Elizabeth I, starring Glenda Jackson, Ronald Hines and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo completes his rail journey through 1930s Britain, beginning in Norfolk at the headquarters of an international horse welfare organisation. In Peterborough, he visits a tidal defence barrier that helped save the city from flooding, while in Lincolnshire crosses the point at which the Mallard broke the speed record for a steam-powered locomotive in 1938. After a spell in the coastal town of Skegness, Michael's journey ends at RAF Coningsby where he sees some iconic Second World War aircraft, before witnessing a dazzling display featuring the RAF's latest combat aircraft

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming gets stuck in the mud in Woodseaves Cutting, and explores the charming canal-side village of Kinver in Staffordshire

programme.title: The Secret Life of Books
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring classic works of fiction, continuing with TV script writer Tony Jordan examining Charles Dickens' popular novel Great Expectations. He investigates why the author changed the ending of the book, and asks what this tells the reader about the writer. Plus, the original texts and manuscripts are examined, which offer clues about the novelist's troubled life, and may have influenced whether Pip would have a future with Estella in the story

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: Chris Packham shines a light on some of the species that show how brainpower, ingenuity and clever tactics are just as important as brawn in the daily battle for survival. Spotted hyenas play politics to gain power, and the female with the most friends rules their group, while being a team player can help when it comes to getting a meal - as demonstrated by vampire bats, who share mouthfuls of blood with strangers in the hope of building a bond and receiving the favour in return

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a new quest as he travels around South-east Asia, guided by his 1913 Bradshaw's Handbook on a 2,500-mile railway adventure across six countries. Beginning in Hong Kong, the former politician investigates how Britain won the island and Kowloon from China after two mid-19th century wars over the trade in opium, before boarding the island's most famous funicular to the Peak, and straddling a bamboo pole to learn the traditional Cantonese art of noodle-making

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming explores the Victorian village of Saltaire on the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. He also moors up in Leeds and goes in search of an abandoned waterway on the Aire and Calder Navigation

programme.title: Jet! When Britain Ruled the Skies
programme.desc: Two-part documentary examining advances in British aviation in the 1950s and 60s, which begins by exploring the design and technology behind a new generation of military planes including the Vulcan bomber and the Meteor jet fighter. The first programme investigates how the achievements came at a time of national austerity, and there is a tragic reminder of how some test pilots paid the ultimate price for their work. Including contributions by Norman Tebbit and Tony Blackman

programme.title: Jesus Christ Superstar (1973)
programme.desc: Musical following the last days in the life of Jesus Christ, seen from the perspective of the disciple Judas, who is gradually tempted into betraying his friend and sending him to his death. Based on the Andrew Lloyd Webber stage show and starring Ted Neeley, Carl Anderson, Yvonne Elliman and Barry Dennan

programme.title: Marti Webb: Tell Me on a Sunday
programme.desc: Filmed concert performance of the one-woman musical show written by Andrew Lloyd Webber and Don Black, starring Marti Webb as an English girl who travels to America in search of love. With the London Philharmonic Orchestra under conductor Harry Rabinowitz

programme.desc: Dennis can’t get Grizzly’s new animal training method to work on wilful Gnasher. However, when they realise that Gnasher can use the method to get humans to obey him instead, they exploit this new power to the max.

programme.desc: Get ready for incredible experiments and mind-bending puzzles to impress your friends with Wow That’s Amazing. In this episode, find out how to make totally trashy music, discover we all grow and shrink in a day, learn that a volcano can erupt in your kitchen, and order a burger… from a robot!

programme.title: Hey You What If?
programme.desc: On the face of it, humans are a bit breakable. We have these hard skeletons that can crack if you have a tumble. But if we were indestructible, like a superhero, then we’d never have to worry about ending up in plaster! So what’s the best way? First we try removing the problem – it’s our bones that break, so let’s get rid of them altogether. Unfortunately, this doesn’t work very well. Without our bones we’d basically be blobs and unable to move anywhere. Okay, metal is tough right? How about taking inspiration from knights in armour, and making our skin solid metal? The problem with metal is that if you hit it hard enough it will actually bend. So, your metal skin would soon be covered with dents and you’d end up completely bent out of shape. What we need is something that can take the knocks without changing shape permanently. What we need is something like rubber, something ‘elastic.’ Elastic materials deform when you hit or stretch them but then they spring back to their original sh

programme.title: OZT Goes Wild in Britain : Coasts
programme.desc: It’s literally a packed show as the OZT HQ is crammed full of some of the fastest-swimming marine life and deepest divers surrounding Britain’s shores. Tyler takes the plunge in Plymouth to reveal how a special marine plant is being brought back from the edge of extinction to help fight climate change. Plucking up courage, he then dives deep to swim with sharks and is amazed by what he discovers about this incredible but sometimes misunderstood species. Just off Britain’s north east coast, Cam also slips into his wetsuit to go snorkelling with seal whisperer Ben. Getting up close with some inquisitive seals, he learns of the threats they face from plastic pollution. It’s all eyes on the Scottish skies as the OZT brothers go on a mission to the Isle of Mull to look for the ultimate soaring sea bird, the white-tailed eagle - but who will spot one first, and can Cam get the perfect picture? Back at OZT HQ, Aaron’s animal knowledge gets put to the test with some quickfire questions from th

programme.title: Hey You What If?
programme.desc: If the beach is too far to go but you still want to spend some time surfing waves, then why not surf on land instead? Well, there are some very good reasons people don’t surf on land. To surf, you need waves which are steep enough that you can literally slide down them – that’s how surfing works. You slide down the face whilst the wave continuously picks you up so you can just keep sliding. Finding waves the right shape on land is quite a challenge. There are naturally occurring waves on land, but they are created as a result of dramatic seismic events like an earthquake or a volcanic eruption. And even if you were standing by a volcano when it went off, the waves it produces aren’t very steep and they’re not very tall. So you really couldn’t surf them. Which leaves you with two alternatives: A. Melt the ground so it becomes a liquid. But then the ground would be over 600 degrees centigrade and destroy your surf board. Or B. Fluidise the ground. Fluidising involves blowing air through

programme.title: OZT Goes Wild in Britain : Grasslands
programme.desc: The OZT brothers are on an adventure to take a closer look at some of Britain's threatened grassland animals. Cam meets 12-year-old wildlife hero and butterfly champion Rebecca to find out why she is so fascinated with butterflies. Meanwhile, Tyler heads to the Forest of Dean to team up with ‘the snake whisperer’, on a mission to track down an adder, one of our most secretive and threatened snakes. When they reach the volcano, the pair hike halfway to the summit with some help from some unexpected furry friends before deciding to camp overnight. A surprise visit from 2021 Strictly champion Rose Ayling-Ellis wakes them up and they complete their trek in style by taking to the skies and flying over the crater in a helicopter

Letitia comes over for a home workout with her personal trainer and Jake and Charlotte play some games in the bedroom

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts an extended episode of the satirical current affairs quiz, with presenter James May and MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to examine the events of May 2022

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Ben Thompson and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A fingerprint on a fish and chips wrapper places a gunman in a rural location and police on a stakeout witness the shooting of their target. Plus, a fraudster uses victim's credit details to buy gift cards at luxury shops until police track him down and find a plethora of evidence on his laptop

programme.title: X-Ray
programme.desc: Lucy Owen is in Porthcawl, hearing from the unhappy customers of a builder, helping a viewer get their money back, and looking back at 22 years of the series

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: This walk takes Derek Brockway to the remote Berwyn mountains, where he walks from Llangynog to the spectacular Pistyll Rhaeadr waterfall, one of the seven wonders of Wales

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts heads to Port Talbot, West Glamorgan, to see a two-bed mid-terrace which has literally been stripped back to brick. Tommy Walsh is in Stoke-on-Trent to see another terraced property which has issues relating to being rather close to an old mineshaft. Jacqui Joseph is in Folkestone, Kent, to see a top floor one-bed flat with a great view, which could prove to be an ideal holiday let

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Mark Stacey guide the Reds and Blues as they go head to head at auction in Detling. Host Eric Knowles also takes a trip to Aylesford Priory

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel gets a concerning phone call and Rob and Karen have something to celebrate. Rob has to deal with feuding neighbours, while Karen's quest for wallpaper gets her in trouble

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay turns two uninspiring dining chairs into a funky bench, and Dom fashions a stool out of concrete. Gardener Joe Swift suggests the right plants for troublesome shady patches

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is in the Essex countryside helping a church minister and his wife, who have a budget of £425,000 to make their very first house purchase. Away from the property search, Sonali discovers how conservation and engineering have been combined to create a landmark coastal nature reserve

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Rare silver asparagus serving tongs and an African birthing chair are among the items bought by Charles Hanson and Raj Bisram as they continue their shopping tour of Wales

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lola is overwhelmed by her family's unwavering support. Rocky enlists Sonia, Reiss and Harvey's help to find his wife but it's Freddie that manages to track her down and give her Kathy's address

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a military bugle for veteran Billy. The instrument once belonged to Billy's great-grandfather and has definitely seen better days. It is now in use at a blind veteran's rehabilitation centre in Llandudno and he's hoping the barn's musical-maestro Pete Woods can bring it back to its former glory. Mark Stuckey is faced with the task of repairing a portable radio that once filled hairdresser Karl's grandfather's salons with musical memories. Charlotte brings in a replica model of Big Ben made almost entirely from matchsticks. The model, measuring just over 5ft, has been handed through generations of Charlotte's family after being built in 1953 to commemorate Queen Elizabeth's coronation and is looking a little worse for ware. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland repairs a pair of children's shoes that are over 75 years old, having been given to 83 year-old Nechama when her family fled Eastern Europe in the 1930's as Hitler rose to power

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The competitors leave the indigenous island of Haida Gwaii and embark on a 2,000 kilometre journey north to the second checkpoint, Dawson City. Claudia and Kevin are the first to leave with a two minute advantage on the rest, Tricia and Cathie set off with different priorities and Zainib and Mobeen continue to rely on the kindness of strangers. Monique's education continues along the journey making father Ladi hopeful and Marc and Michael have a spat over Marc's fear of bears

programme.desc: Twenty-three year-old Chiedza converted to Islam three years ago. Now, she is trying to find a husband and has decided to follow traditional and modern Muslim dating rules. programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones, Ronan Keating and a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: All hell breaks loose in No 45 as Rocky's wife turns up. Sonia invites Reiss to visit Bangkok with her to meet Bex and Lola's fundraiser is a huge success, but things become awkward with her and Emma

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Entrepreneurs pitch their money-making ideas to a panel of self-made millionaires Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. A surgeon-turned-inventor thinks he's solved a universal problem for parents, while low strength gin gets tastebuds tingling. A Norwich-based couple pitch their children's storage baskets with a twist, and an entrepreneur is on a mission to eliminate the dreaded sweat patch. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - £150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Talk Disability: Invisible Disabilities
programme.desc: Chris McEwen has lived a life of extremes, from the highs of boxing and serving in the Army, to periods of deep depression and suicide attempts. However, it wasn't until he was diagnosed as bipolar that things started to make sense. He now gives opportunities to youngsters with disabilities by teaching them to box

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate from Bristol, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from an invited audience

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team re-examine the double murder of two men from Blaenavon who were brutally murdered in 1972 that has remained unsolved for over 50 years. Following last orders at The Rifleman's Arms, the two men made the short walk home, but in a seemingly unprovoked attack, both were bludgeoned to death with a coal pick

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Charles Hanson tour Wales, picking up a rare toby jug and some art deco items. They also learn about an ancient fishing tradition and a Welsh Olympic legend

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sonia gives Rocky an ultimatum, either he tells Kathy his secret by the end of the day, or she will. Lola is determined to plan a successful fundraiser and Keanu declares his love for a conflicted Sharon. Sam and Alfie drown their sorrows over their failed love lives at The Vic

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers work in pairs to transform three independent shops in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, on a budget of £3,000 in just two days. Ry and Jack struggle to relate to the clientele of the shoe shop they're designing and Alan wonders if Ry has lost his mojo. Tom and Temi are paired together to transform the Sheepskin shop, but a disagreement over colour schemes could derail their design before it has even been made. Monika and Peter get to work on a minimalist but functional scheme for a fashion store but Monika worries she has bitten off more than she can chew

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The second leg of their trip takes Anton and Giovanni to Mount Etna, Europe's highest and most active volcano. Along the way Giovanni takes Anton to a traditional Sicilian barber to get beach ready before trying paddleboarding in the Ionian Sea. When they reach the volcano, the pair hike halfway to the summit with some help from some unexpected furry friends before deciding to camp overnight. A surprise visit from 2021 Strictly champion Rose Ayling-Ellis wakes them up and they complete their trek in style by taking to the skies and flying over the crater in a helicopter

programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a buyer with a budget of £450,000 escape her ex-council flat in south London so her and her daughter can start a new life in the Wiltshire countryside

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Charles Hanson tour Wales, picking up a rare toby jug and some art deco items. They also learn about an ancient fishing tradition and a Welsh Olympic legend

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Ben, Theo, Tobias and Niamh try to find the right path across the bridge in the hope of winning some cash. Game show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sonia gives Rocky an ultimatum, either he tells Kathy his secret by the end of the day, or she will. Lola is determined to plan a successful fundraiser and Keanu declares his love for a conflicted Sharon. Sam and Alfie drown their sorrows over their failed love lives at The Vic

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers work in pairs to transform three independent shops in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, on a budget of £3,000 in just two days. Ry and Jack struggle to relate to the clientele of the shoe shop they're designing and Alan wonders if Ry has lost his mojo. Tom and Temi are paired together to transform the Sheepskin shop, but a disagreement over colour schemes could derail their design before it has even been made. Monika and Peter get to work on a minimalist but functional scheme for a fashion store but Monika worries she has bitten off more than she can chew

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The second leg of their trip takes Anton and Giovanni to Mount Etna, Europe's highest and most active volcano. Along the way Giovanni takes Anton to a traditional Sicilian barber to get beach ready before trying paddleboarding in the Ionian Sea. When they reach the volcano, the pair hike halfway to the summit with some help from some unexpected furry friends before deciding to camp overnight. A surprise visit from 2021 Strictly champion Rose Ayling-Ellis wakes them up and they complete their trek in style by taking to the skies and flying over the crater in a helicopter

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Prime Ministers of Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Alvin Jackson delves into Basil Brooke and Terence O'Neill's terms in as Prime Minister including how Brooke dealt with the IRA's border campaign in the 1950's. Plus, how O'Neill's attempts to deliver reforms demanded by the Civil Rights movement were challenged from within the Ulster Unionist party and the rise of Ian Paisley

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: After an emotional scan, Charlotte announces her pregnancy to the world and her best friend Lauren is called in to help with a grand plan to take over York Fashion Week. Letitia comes over for a home workout with her personal trainer and Jake and Charlotte play some games in the bedroom

programme.title: Darkest Hour (2017)
programme.desc: May 1940. As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to leave neighbouring countries to their fate, by striking a peace deal with Hitler, or fight on against terrifying odds for the greater good. Double Oscar and Bafta-winning period drama, starring Gary Oldman, Lily James and Kristin Scott Thomas

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Ben Thompson and Sally Nugent present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A fingerprint on a fish and chips wrapper places a gunman in a rural location and police on a stakeout witness the shooting of their target. Plus, a fraudster uses victim's credit details to buy gift cards at luxury shops until police track him down and find a plethora of evidence on his laptop

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The tiger cubs are growing fast but one youngster is fighting with his family. It's normal behaviour, but the keepers must act fast to prevent serious injuries

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts heads to Port Talbot, West Glamorgan, to see a two-bed mid-terrace which has literally been stripped back to brick. Tommy Walsh is in Stoke-on-Trent to see another terraced property which has issues relating to being rather close to an old mineshaft. Jacqui Joseph is in Folkestone, Kent, to see a top floor one-bed flat with a great view, which could prove to be an ideal holiday let

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Mark Stacey guide the Reds and Blues as they go head to head at auction in Detling. Host Eric Knowles also takes a trip to Aylesford Priory

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel gets a concerning phone call and Rob and Karen have something to celebrate. Rob has to deal with feuding neighbours, while Karen's quest for wallpaper gets her in trouble

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay turns two uninspiring dining chairs into a funky bench, and Dom fashions a stool out of concrete. Gardener Joe Swift suggests the right plants for troublesome shady patches

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is in the Essex countryside helping a church minister and his wife, who have a budget of £425,000 to make their very first house purchase. Away from the property search, Sonali discovers how conservation and engineering have been combined to create a landmark coastal nature reserve

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Rare silver asparagus serving tongs and an African birthing chair are among the items bought by Charles Hanson and Raj Bisram as they continue their shopping tour of Wales

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, challenging family team Asim, Isa, Shahid and Attiq to find a safe path across the bridge, choosing the truths and avoiding the lies

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lola is overwhelmed by her family's unwavering support. Rocky enlists Sonia, Reiss and Harvey's help to find his wife but it's Freddie that manages to track her down and give her Kathy's address

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a military bugle for veteran Billy. The instrument once belonged to Billy's great-grandfather and has definitely seen better days. It is now in use at a blind veteran's rehabilitation centre in Llandudno and he's hoping the barn's musical-maestro Pete Woods can bring it back to its former glory. Mark Stuckey is faced with the task of repairing a portable radio that once filled hairdresser Karl's grandfather's salons with musical memories. Charlotte brings in a replica model of Big Ben made almost entirely from matchsticks. The model, measuring just over 5ft, has been handed through generations of Charlotte's family after being built in 1953 to commemorate Queen Elizabeth's coronation and is looking a little worse for ware. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland repairs a pair of children's shoes that are over 75 years old, having been given to 83 year-old Nechama when her family fled Eastern Europe in the 1930's as Hitler rose to power

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The competitors leave the indigenous island of Haida Gwaii and embark on a 2,000 kilometre journey north to the second checkpoint, Dawson City. Claudia and Kevin are the first to leave with a two minute advantage on the rest, Tricia and Cathie set off with different priorities and Zainib and Mobeen continue to rely on the kindness of strangers. Monique's education continues along the journey making father Ladi hopeful and Marc and Michael have a spat over Marc's fear of bears

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Prime Ministers of Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Alvin Jackson explores how James Chichester-Clark reacted to the outbreak of civil disorder in August 1969, and the decisive events that brought about the fall of Brian Faulkner and the Stormont government in 1972

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Twenty-three year-old Chiedza converted to Islam three years ago. Now, she is trying to find a husband and has decided to follow traditional and modern Muslim dating rules. She tries a marriage introduction day at a mosque, a Muslim-only dating app and a live dating event with a difference. Will she find love? And will her mother approve?

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: When Lily announces she's pregnant, Tim is convinced she's lying but goes along with it and proposes. Idris plans a stag do to remember but not everyone agrees with his idea of a good time. Ruth takes matters into her own hands

programme.title: Live NBA
programme.desc: Philadelphia 76ers v Dallas Mavericks (Tip-off 12.30am). All the action from the inter-conference clash at Wells Fargo Centre

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Helen Skelton host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A jacket recovered from a suspect's home has the DNA of not one, but two, stabbing victims on it as police hunt for the person behind a series of seemingly unprovoked attacks. There's little for detectives to go on after a man is left to die in the street and when the attacker strikes again they are in a race against time to find the person responsible. Plus, a fingerprint found on the number plate of the getaway car used in the armed robbery of a neighbourhood pub leads officers to their suspect

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers have a challenge on their hands when two-year-old porcupine Spud goes missing. How do you find an escaped animal, amongst a million trees, that's perfectly camouflaged? Elsewhere, the future for one of the legends of the park, Dave the wolf, hangs in the balance. Everything points to an infection, but initial medication doesn't seem to be working. Presented by Ben Fogle and Kate Humble

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Martin Roberts and Tommy Walsh view properties in Stockport in Greater Manchester, Bargoed in south Wales and South Benfleet in Essex, before finding out what improvements the buyers made

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Richard Madley and Kate Bliss help two teams competing in Builth Wells, Powys. Presenter Charlie Ross monitors proceedings and also learns about Wales' washing machine industry

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob and Karen's big night out takes a shocking turn and Scarlett's evening ends in disaster. Jimmi's advice falls on deaf ears. Medical drama series set in a busy Midlands surgery

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay Blades constructs a bird bath from old crockery, and the Flog It! team share their tips on buying animal-related antiques

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor is in Somerset with a couple on their maiden house hunt together. While in the county, she visits a cottage that Samuel Taylor Coleridge once called home.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Charles Hanson arrive in Shrewsbury, where Raj finds out how a 19th-century flax mill changed city skylines around the world and Charles learns about the dramatic escape of Charles II during the English civil war. While shopping in Shropshire is considered successful, the duo's plan to spend the night in the great outdoors proves disastrous

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Georgina, Ross, Sophie and Warren compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones, Ronan Keating and a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: All hell breaks loose in No 45 as Rocky's wife turns up. Sonia invites Reiss to visit Bangkok with her to meet Bex and Lola's fundraiser is a huge success, but things become awkward with her and Emma

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Entrepreneurs pitch their money-making ideas to a panel of self-made millionaires Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. A surgeon-turned-inventor thinks he's solved a universal problem for parents, while low strength gin gets tastebuds tingling. A Norwich-based couple pitch their children's storage baskets with a twist, and an entrepreneur is on a mission to eliminate the dreaded sweat patch. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - £150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The View

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate from Bristol, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from an invited audience

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Lily's plan to scam the wedding venue is in danger when Tim tries to help. Idris has a crisis about the bookshop becoming a symbol of capitalistic greed

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.desc: Millions of council houses were built after the war to help protect people from slum landlords. They used to be home to around a third of the UK population. Margaret Thatcher's flagship right-to-buy policy boosted home ownership, but the council house sell-off is causing major problems 40 years on. Reporter Richard Bilton investigates what's been happening by telling the story of one housing estate in London

programme.title: Witness History
programme.desc: Witness History's Farhana Haider is at the People's History Museum in Manchester looking back at five extraordinary campaigns and protest movements headed by women, including the South Asian women workers who led a strike against poor working conditions in a British factory. We also speak to one of the women fighting for the equal right to pray at the Western Wall in Jerusalem. We meet the forensic anthropologist in Argentina who founded a team dedicated to digging for evidence of crimes against humanity. In Canada, we speak to one of the Mohawk activists who spent months in a stand-off with the country's military over plans to develop a golf course on sacred burial ground. Plus, how an anti-war march turned into a peace camp that endured for nearly 20 years outside an American air base in rural England.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team share their favourite money saving gardening tips, creating classic garden features that are big on impact and easy on the pocket. With the average cost of a full garden makeover now believed to be between seven and ten thousand pounds, Katie Rushworth and David Domoney come to the aid of two families of garden novices, who only half that amount to spend. Taking totally different approaches and encouraging the garden owners to get stuck in, they will try and help them build their dream garden without going over the three and half thousand-pound budget. Will the owners be impressed by the money saving makeovers?

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Sisters Oti and Motsi Mabuse head on a journey across their homeland of South Africa to explore their extraordinary family history. The sisters have tried to explore their history before, but with records for black South Africans almost non-existent, going on their DNA journey is the last roll of the dice to discover their roots. Beginning their journey just north of Johannesburg, the sisters are delighted to connect with their cousin Samantha, who reveals their familial link to an African Royal family. Later, the pair trace other branches of their family line and discover a brave ancestor who fought in World War Two, before finding out they are also related to the famous South African musician, Hotstix Mabuse

programme.desc: Seven million on the NHS waiting list means seven million stories of fading health, pain and the fear treatment may come too late. Emily Morgan meets some of those selling homes, taking loans and fundraising to buy back their health

programme.title: Jason & Clara: In Memory of Maudie
programme.desc: Actor Jason Watkins and his wife Clara Francis tell the emotional story of their daughter Maudie, who died suddenly aged just two and a half in the early hours of New Year's Day 2011. Maudie died of undiagnosed sepsis, a condition where the body's immune system overreacts to an infection, causing it to go into overdrive and attack the body's tissues and organs. Since the tragedy, Jason and Clara have been seeking to raise awareness of sepsis and also to help and give hope to other bereaved parents. Now, as the family are about to move from the flat where Maudie was born and died, they feel the time is right to tell their story and explore their own grief

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team share their favourite money saving gardening tips, creating classic garden features that are big on impact and easy on the pocket. With the average cost of a full garden makeover now believed to be between seven and ten thousand pounds, Katie Rushworth and David Domoney come to the aid of two families of garden novices, who only half that amount to spend. Taking totally different approaches and encouraging the garden owners to get stuck in, they will try and help them build their dream garden without going over the three and half thousand-pound budget. Will the owners be impressed by the money saving makeovers?

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Sisters Oti and Motsi Mabuse head on a journey across their homeland of South Africa to explore their extraordinary family history. The sisters have tried to explore their history before, but with records for black South Africans almost non-existent, going on their DNA journey is the last roll of the dice to discover their roots. Beginning their journey just north of Johannesburg, the sisters are delighted to connect with their cousin Samantha, who reveals their familial link to an African Royal family. Later, the pair trace other branches of their family line and discover a brave ancestor who fought in World War Two, before finding out they are also related to the famous South African musician, Hotstix Mabuse
