programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Seven million on the NHS waiting list means seven million stories of fading health, pain and the fear treatment may come too late. As experts warn of a deadly toll, record numbers have turned to private healthcare - both here and abroad. Emily Morgan meets some of those selling homes, taking loans and fundraising to buy back their health

programme.title: Jason & Clara: In Memory of Maudie
programme.desc: Actor Jason Watkins and his wife Clara Francis tell the emotional story of their daughter Maudie, who died suddenly aged just two and a half in the early hours of New Year's Day 2011. Maudie died of undiagnosed sepsis, a condition where the body's immune system overreacts to an infection, causing it to go into overdrive and attack the body's tissues and organs. Since the tragedy, Jason and Clara have been seeking to raise awareness of sepsis and also to help and give hope to other bereaved parents. Now, as the family are about to move from the flat where Maudie was born and died, they feel the time is right to tell their story and explore their own grief

programme.desc: Rachel invites everyone for a weekend away at her family's cabin, where Peyton receives an unexpected visitor. Meanwhile, Karen confronts Dan about Keith's death. Drama, starring Danneel Harris

programme.title: The O.C.
programme.desc: Marissa's sister Kaitlin returns from boarding school for the winter holidays, and is quickly brought up to speed with her family's recent problems. Meanwhile, a young man shows up at Ryan's house claiming he has unfinished business with the new arrival. Mischa Barton stars

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Charlene White, Russell Kane and Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Amy brings her daughter to work when she finds herself without a babysitter, while Dina chases a shoplifter

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Amy and Jonah become competitive when he passes his employee training test with flying colours. A secret shopper visits the store. Comedy, starring America Ferrera

programme.title: Loaded in Paradise
programme.desc: Paige and Rianna are elected to become the new Spenders by the rest of the group and lead a high-octane Chase into Rhodes town

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter secretly gets a credit card and overspends the family money, so Lois grounds him. In a bid to make the perfect escape, Peter builds a tunnel leading directly to The Drunken Clam bar

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie questions everything he has ever won after receiving a participation medal at school, while Peter causes a fight between Lois's parents

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The network decides it is time to reboot the series, and three versions are shown to a focus group, but the feedback takes everyone by surprise

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan is given pills by a colleague that enable him to stay awake all night so he can spend more time enjoying his hobbies, but when Francine discovers his nocturnal activities, she wants to join him. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger try to write a script for a pornographic film

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan gets a new position as his boss's adviser and is delighted to accommodate his every request. However, the job begins to threaten his personal life and Francine is roped in to help complete an outrageous task, ruining her plans to spend Valentine's Day with her husband

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: The employees are given a chance to win a cash bonus if they hit a sales target by the end of the day

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: At the store's wedding day sale, Cheyenne and Bo make lavish purchases for their own nuptials. Glenn uses the promotion to show his support for same-sex marriage

programme.title: Hey Tracey!
programme.desc: Comedy quiz hosted by Joel Dommett, with Joey Essex, Amber Davies, Arron Crascall, Frankie Bridge, AJ Odudu and Russell Kane making cold calls to businesses to try to get the answers to quiz questions and win money for members of the public

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: A selection of some of the most incredible and peculiar record-breaking attempts, including the tallest human pyramid and the longest ramp jump with a caravan. Matt Edmondson narrates

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Syd gives Chloe an ultimatum, Viv is stunned as Scott makes a confession and Zoe fears her baby may be taken into care

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Zoe refuses to accept the truth about her baby, while Chris immediately accuses Scott of rape. At Pear Tree Cottage, Chloe is devastated by the news and throws her boyfriend out

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tyrone takes drastic action to stop Maria leaving for Canada, and Shelley finds it hard to forgive Peter for not trusting her

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Kevin and Sally give in to their feelings, Gail comes up with a plan to ease Richard's money troubles, and Dev puts a proposition to Mike

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Mr Roper decides he will not allow the flatmates to have a party. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: When the trio decide they need a fourth person to share the flat, Robin is determined it will be a woman. Seventies comedy, with Richard O'Sullivan

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David and Anna have a secret romance, Beth starts to feel paranoid about the amount of time Tom is spending at the factory, and Nathan and Kate both have important decisions to make about their futures. Starring Philip Middlemiss, Lesley Dunlop, Kerrie Taylor, Julian Lewis Jones, Adam Paul Harvey and Jenny Platt

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna and Tom meet with Ozias Harding, a potential investor at the factory, but David is concerned that the stern disciplinarian could be bad news for the business. Meanwhile, Billy has some upsetting news for Sally, and Beth finds herself in danger when she nurses an elderly lady with a 40-year secret. Starring new cast member Brian Capron and guest Thelma Barlow

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A murder gives rise to rumours of a communist conspiracy. Poirot becomes the centre of attention at the Chelsea Flower Show as he views a rose named in his honour, while Hastings receives a packet of seeds that give him hay fever. Whodunit, guest starring Anne Stallybrass (Heartbeat), with David Suchet

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Eternal bachelor Greengrass falls in love with an aristocratic lady poacher, and an old flame of Mike's turns up out of the blue to complicate his life. Rural capers, starring Nick Berry, Natasha Dahlberg and Frances de la Tour

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: The police investigate Chris's allegations, Zoe goes to see her nanny, and Debbie goes to stay with the Dingles

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Scott's life falls apart as Chris gets his revenge, so when Syd lets slip that Chloe caused one of Jean's injuries, fists fly yet again. Zoe is shocked by the DNA test results

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: The atmosphere is strained between Sally and Kevin, and Richard accepts Gail's offer to remortgage the house

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard gives Gail a lesson in the art of lying to the bank manager, Peter gives Shelley an ultimatum and Doreen accuses Vera of defacing her beautiful name-plate

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The naked body of a business executive is found dumped in a rival factory's steriliser machine, leaving Barnaby and Scott with a complicated mystery to unravel. Their investigation begins with factory owners the Plummers, who seem to be hiding more than their share of secrets. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, John Hopkins, Annette Crosbie and Jasper Britton

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Tempers fray as a kind gesture by Isobel backfires, while Mary fights Branson's corner when his decisions are put under scrutiny. Robert and Cora's relationship is under pressure, but can Violet make them see things differently? Bates goes to extreme lengths as his chance of freedom slips away. Costume drama, starring Penelope Wilton, Hugh Bonneville and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A woman is admitted to hospital after a series of burglaries, and Nick and Jo start planning their life together. Greengrass and Bernie try their hand at modern art. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a priceless music score leads to startling revelations about its composer's life. As Barnaby and Scott investigate, they discover the manuscript may also provide them with the clue they need to solve the case of a local man found battered to death in his cottage. Guest starring June Whitfield and Trevor Peacock

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: Detective and single mother Janine Lewis suffers a close shave when a colleague is murdered just metres away from where she and her partner DI Richard Mayne are standing. The pair must come to terms with the shocking encounter as they delve further into the case, uncovering a connection between a hit-and-run and an attempted jewellery robbery that went horribly wrong. Crime drama, starring Caroline Quentin

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Two grieving widows lay rival claims to a corpse found washed up on the beach, each insisting it is the body of her missing husband. While it is obvious only one can be telling the truth, the detective finds it tricky to discern which of the women is lying - and why. Drama, guest starring Eleanor Bron, with Jack Shepherd

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David and Anna have a secret romance, Beth starts to feel paranoid about the amount of time Tom is spending at the factory, and Nathan and Kate both have important decisions to make about their futures. Starring Philip Middlemiss, Lesley Dunlop, Kerrie Taylor, Julian Lewis Jones, Adam Paul Harvey and Jenny Platt

programme.desc: When Chrissy receives two tickets for a Frank Sinatra concert, everyone wants to be her friend. Comedy, starring Paula Wilcox

programme.title: Man About the House

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: The flatmates crave a bit of summer warmth, and Mrs Roper's sunlamp mysteriously disappears. Comedy, with Richard O'Sullivan

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ozias Harding makes his presence felt in Skelthwaite by ruthlessly firing Alan from the factory, while Luke is rushed to hospital after a serious accident on the rugby field, and Beth has a chance to test her maternal instincts when she is asked to lead the children's Moon Catching Expedition. Starring Brian Capron, Keith Barron, Christian Cooke and Kerrie Taylor

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna is unsure whether she should tell Luke the truth about his chances of recovery after his near-fatal rugby accident, and Ozias Harding's persistent bullying forces Billy to resign from the factory, leading Nathan to take revenge against the businessman by asking out his daughter Alice. Lesley Dunlop, Brian Capron and Andrew Paul star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A prominent bank manager is almost killed by a hit-and-run driver just before he is due to set sail on the luxury liner Queen Mary. Convinced his life is in danger, he persuades Poirot to accompany him - and his valuable shipment of liberty bonds - to New York. But the Belgian sleuth's main concern is his own terrible sea-sickness. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A woman is admitted to hospital after a series of burglaries, and Nick and Jo start planning their life together. Greengrass and Bernie try their hand at modern art. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chloe realises she could face a jail sentence, while Chris is busy plotting Scott's downfall. Robert and Elaine take their driving tests, but only one of them passes

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chris strives to mend his marriage, but Charity would rather visit Debbie than spend time with him and ends up cavorting through the village with Cain

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard's pride takes a battering during his visit to the bank manager, Blanche puts her foot in it with Peter, and Sally decides to apply for a job at Rosie's school

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard nearly cracks and tells Gail the truth after he receives another reminder to pay for the wedding, while Karen finally meets her match

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A house-hunting couple are found dead shortly after viewing a supposedly haunted cottage. Locals claim the property is cursed - but Barnaby and Jones soon hear enough to suspect several builders, developers and estate agents of resorting to murder. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with George Baker, Ruth Gemmell and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: It's a happy day for Downton as Anna's patience is rewarded, while Edith receives admiration from an unexpected quarter. Matthew refuses to back down over the estate management, but will his tactics pay off? Branson's plan for the christening causes consternation, as does the arrival of his brother, and O'Brien's motives are unclear as she counsels Thomas. Julian Fellowes' period drama, starring Joanne Froggatt, Laura Carmichael, Dan Stevens and Allen Leech

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick, Jo and Katie prepare to leave Aidensfield, while mysterious bumps in the night make Greengrass wonder if his house is haunted. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate the murder of a businesswoman connected with an organisation that supports gifted children, who had apparently been blackmailing the father of one particularly promising youngster. Further deaths follow, and as the body count rises, they realise there is a decades-old secret at the heart of the case. Matters are complicated still further by the presence in Oxford of former MI5 spymaster Grace Orde, who is visiting to sign copies of her tell-all memoir - which provides a vital clue to the killer's identity. Detective drama, guest starring Anna Chancellor and Cherie Lunghi, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: A builder finds the body of a three-year-old child in a drainage tunnel between two houses and the father soon falls under suspicion. It's a particularly tough case for mother-of-four Janine, who is caught up in the recriminations of the grieving parents - especially when her ex-husband Pete delivers the shocking news that the dead child is not who they thought. Crime drama, starring Caroline Quentin and Ian Kelsey

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance of a sheep farmer leads Wycliffe into the heart of a rural community whose apparently tranquil surface conceals a desperate struggle for survival. It is not long before he uncovers disturbing evidence suggesting foul play. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ozias Harding makes his presence felt in Skelthwaite by ruthlessly firing Alan from the factory, while Luke is rushed to hospital after a serious accident on the rugby field, and Beth has a chance to test her maternal instincts when she is asked to lead the children's Moon Catching Expedition. Starring Brian Capron, Keith Barron, Christian Cooke and Kerrie Taylor

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Chrissy and Jo are entranced when they meet Robin's older brother. Comedy, with Richard O'Sullivan

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Robin and his brother lock horns over Chrissy's affections, while Mr Roper tries his hand at chimney sweeping. Comedy, with Richard O'Sullivan

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Luke arrives back home in a wheelchair, but quickly becomes frustrated and takes his anger out on David. Charlie tries to avoid his daughter Charlotte when she returns from Italy and Nathan convinces Alice to keep their relationship secret - a move which drives her to accept a date with Joe

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A patient's wife accuses Sally of having an affair with her husband, putting pressure on the nurse's career and marriage, while Nathan and Joe find out the truth about Alice's two-timing and a bored Alan discovers he has won the star prize on a scratch card. Ex-EastEnder Martin Kemp guest stars

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth is asked to vet potential suitors vying for the hand of an Australian heiress and discreetly accompanies her on a rail journey aboard the Plymouth Express, only to find himself investigating a jewel theft. Mystery, with David Suchet and Julian Wadham

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick, Jo and Katie prepare to leave Aidensfield, while mysterious bumps in the night make Greengrass wonder if his house is haunted. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chris warns Charity to stay away from Cain, but with Debbie at the Dingles', it's impossible for her to comply, leading to a confrontation

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chris's inability to trust Charity threatens to drive them apart. She tries to persuade Debbie to return home, but the plan backfires thanks to Cain

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard feels distinctly uneasy as Audrey grills him about his 'stolen' car and Kevin is confused when Sally gives out mixed signals about her interest in him

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sally and Kevin agree to go back to separate sleeping arrangements, Audrey offers Richard financial help, and Fiz and Janice show Karen up at the furniture store

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate when the body of a woman is pulled from the river during the local Oak Apple carnival. Closer inspection suggests the drowning was deliberate - and, as the detectives find out more about the villagers, they learn the killing could be linked to the death of the victim's daughter eight years previously. John Nettles and Jason Hughes play the intrepid policemen, with guest star Simon Callow

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: There is excitement throughout the house and nearby village as the annual cricket match draws near, and the event brings out Robert's competitive side. Violet's great-niece Rose arrives, but a trip to London reveals there is more to her than meets the eye, while Matthew and Mary seem to be keeping secrets from each other. Thomas's future appears to be uncertain, but he may have found an unexpected ally in Bates

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is abducted by an old Army friend and former Japanese PoW camp inmate, whose wife's death has left him mentally unbalanced, while Greengrass is well and truly fleeced by father-and-son con-men. Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds and John Alderton star

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the case of murdered entrepreneur Freddie Gill, whose body is found by bailiffs attempting to repossess his house. As she delves into the case, she soon comes to understand that Freddie's professional life is just as turbulent as his family life, and Vera must uncover whether the motive behind Freddie's death comes from the trouble at the heart of his family, a desperate financial crises, or his glances with organised crime. Starring Brenda Blethyn, Kenny Doughty and Jon Morrison

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: Janine investigates when a man recently released from prison is found strangled with a dog chain. It appears to be an open-and-shut case when Vinny McAteer admits killing his son-in-law, but the detective, harassed by the arrival of new boss Det Supt Louise Hogg, soon finds all the dead man's in-laws are queuing up to confess individually to the crime. Tom Bell guest stars

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A schoolgirl is found dead after a disco, and Cornish copper Charles Wycliffe applies himself to the task of discovering whether she was murdered or committed suicide. Jack Shepherd and Helen Masters star

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Luke arrives back home in a wheelchair, but quickly becomes frustrated and takes his anger out on David. programme.desc: Chloe realises she could face a jail sentence, while Chris is busy plotting Scott's downfall. Robert and Elaine take their driving tests, but only one of them passes

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chris strives to mend his marriage, but Charity would rather visit Debbie than spend time with him and ends up cavorting through the village with Cain

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard's pride takes a battering during his visit to the bank manager, Blanche puts her foot in it with Peter, and Sally decides to apply for a job at Rosie's school

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard nearly cracks and tells Gail the truth after he receives another reminder to pay for the wedding, while Karen finally meets her match

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A house-hunting couple are found dead shortly after viewing a supposedly haunted cottage. Locals claim the property is cursed - but Barnaby and Jones soon hear enough to suspect several builders, developers and estate agents of resorting to murder. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with George Baker, Ruth Gemmell and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: It's a happy day for Downton as Anna's patience is rewarded, while Edith receives admiration from an unexpected quarter. Matthew refuses to back down over the estate management, but will his tactics pay off? Branson's plan for the christening causes consternation, as does the arrival of his brother, and O'Brien's motives are unclear as she counsels Thomas. Julian Fellowes' period drama, starring Joanne Froggatt, Laura Carmichael, Dan Stevens and Allen Leech

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick, Jo and Katie prepare to leave Aidensfield, while mysterious bumps in the night make Greengrass wonder if his house is haunted. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate the murder of a businesswoman connected with an organisation that supports gifted children, who had apparently been blackmailing the father of one particularly promising youngster. Further deaths follow, and as the body count rises, they realise there is a decades-old secret at the heart of the case. Matters are complicated still further by the presence in Oxford of former MI5 spymaster Grace Orde, who is visiting to sign copies of her tell-all memoir - which provides a vital clue to the killer's identity. Detective drama, guest starring Anna Chancellor and Cherie Lunghi, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: A builder finds the body of a three-year-old child in a drainage tunnel between two houses and the father soon falls under suspicion. It's a particularly tough case for mother-of-four Janine, who is caught up in the recriminations of the grieving parents - especially when her ex-husband Pete delivers the shocking news that the dead child is not who they thought. Crime drama, starring Caroline Quentin and Ian Kelsey

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance of a sheep farmer leads Wycliffe into the heart of a rural community whose apparently tranquil surface conceals a desperate struggle for survival. It is not long before he uncovers disturbing evidence suggesting foul play. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ozias Harding makes his presence felt in Skelthwaite by ruthlessly firing Alan from the factory, while Luke is rushed to hospital after a serious accident on the rugby field, and Beth has a chance to test her maternal instincts when she is asked to lead the children's Moon Catching Expedition. Starring Brian Capron, Keith Barron, Christian Cooke and Kerrie Taylor

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Mr Roper decides he will not allow the flatmates to have a party. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A patient's wife accuses Sally of having an affair with her husband, putting pressure on the nurse's career and marriage, while Nathan and Joe find out the truth about Alice's two-timing and a bored Alan discovers he has won the star prize on a scratch card. Ex-EastEnder Martin Kemp guest stars

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth is asked to vet potential suitors vying for the hand of an Australian heiress and discreetly accompanies her on a rail journey aboard the Plymouth Express, only to find himself investigating a jewel theft. Mystery, with David Suchet and Julian Wadham

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chris's inability to trust Charity threatens to drive them apart. She tries to persuade Debbie to return home, but the plan backfires thanks to Cain

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard feels distinctly uneasy as Audrey grills him about his 'stolen' car and Kevin is confused when Sally gives out mixed signals about her interest in him

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sally and Kevin agree to go back to separate sleeping arrangements, Audrey offers Richard financial help, and Fiz and Janice show Karen up at the furniture store

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate when the body of a woman is pulled from the river during the local Oak Apple carnival. Closer inspection suggests the drowning was deliberate - and, as the detectives find out more about the villagers, they learn the killing could be linked to the death of the victim's daughter eight years previously. John Nettles and Jason Hughes play the intrepid policemen, with guest star Simon Callow

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: There is excitement throughout the house and nearby village as the annual cricket match draws near, and the event brings out Robert's competitive side. Violet's great-niece Rose arrives, but a trip to London reveals there is more to her than meets the eye, while Matthew and Mary seem to be keeping secrets from each other. Thomas's future appears to be uncertain, but he may have found an unexpected ally in Bates

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is abducted by an old Army friend and former Japanese PoW camp inmate, whose wife's death has left him mentally unbalanced, while Greengrass is well and truly fleeced by father-and-son con-men. Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds and John Alderton star

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the case of murdered entrepreneur Freddie Gill, whose body is found by bailiffs attempting to repossess his house. As she delves into the case, she soon comes to understand that Freddie's professional life is just as turbulent as his family life, and Vera must uncover whether the motive behind Freddie's death comes from the trouble at the heart of his family, a desperate financial crises, or his glances with organised crime. Starring Brenda Blethyn, Kenny Doughty and Jon Morrison

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: Janine investigates when a man recently released from prison is found strangled with a dog chain. It appears to be an open-and-shut case when Vinny McAteer admits killing his son-in-law, but the detective, harassed by the arrival of new boss Det Supt Louise Hogg, soon finds all the dead man's in-laws are queuing up to confess individually to the crime. Tom Bell guest stars

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A schoolgirl is found dead after a disco, and Cornish copper Charles Wycliffe applies himself to the task of discovering whether she was murdered or committed suicide. Jack Shepherd and Helen Masters star

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid

The Monkie Kid team is pushed to breaking point, and nothing will be the same again!

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. When Krupp challenges the campers to climb Plummet Peak, the kids are wary due to the legend of Altitooth, a yeti-like creature said to terrorise climbers. When George and Harold reach the summit, they instead find a famous missing mountaineer pretending to be Altitooth - meanwhile, Melvin's climbing invention goes haywire...

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: The ninja learn Darreth's Mojo Dojo is to be destroyed, so enter the annual NinjaBall Run in a bid to raise funds to save it

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Horror - Mo forgot to do his art studio homework! He fills the gap in a flash by taking one of his mother's anatomical models to school to pass it off as his own creation. It works, but Selina quickly realises that the foot is missing and warns Mo that he'll be in serious trouble - to make things worse, the model foot is stuffed with Mo's favourite video game, the one that Selina took from him and hid! Mo therefore has to break into Brick's office in order to get it back.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is due to take part in an eloquence contest whose prize was won by her mother and her grandmother when they were young - the pressure is on Sam, and that makes her unbelievably tense. Sam realises that she is lost for words when she feels stressed - to avoid catastrophe, she asks the Sceptre for the power of repartee. The half-power does provide her with snappy answers, but they are extremely caustic, and that's just the start of her problems...

programme.title: Craig of the Creek

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo thinks that he's going to become a star when Mr Brick chooses him to represent the school in his new advertising campaign, but Mo instead finds his face on a huge billboard with a line telling everybody that he is a very poor student. Angry, Mo wants to get rid of such publicity right now, so he summons the power to control advertising, but he realises that he is forced to advertise everything that he touches at half-power and ends up managing to close the school.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. While searching for a game console that Selina has confiscated, Mo finds two tickets for the 'Isaac the Psychic' show, but only one child's ticket! Lenny feels sorry for his buddy, but when he tries to console him, he makes things worse without meaning to. Mo is eaten up with paranoia as he's convinced that Sam has always been their mother's favourite - to make sure that he's the one that Selina takes, Mo invokes the power to be the favourite of whoever he wants...

Worse, he soon discovers he has no control over his speed. He causes terrible damage, which has an unexpected effect on Amber. Mo has to find Sam, fix the grocery store - and fix Amber too!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes

Sam is desperate to join an Endangered Species Protection Association and asks the Scepter for the power to be really funny, so she can win the jury's attention during her online interview. When she goes to look for Mo, Sam is snapped up by Mr. Brick - who, it so happens, used to be a professional clown himself!

Velma turns to a close friend that's in Paris for work. It's none other than famous fashion model Gigi Hadid! Velma and Gigi studied Criminal Psychology together and Velma was always impressed with how great Gigi is at picking up clues. Gigi happily joins our gang to get to the bottom of this mysterious gargoyle and what it's really after in the City of Lights. Clues lead to forged paintings and an art theft in the Louvre and the destruction of Paris Fashion Week by the gargoyle! The hunters being armed with the powers of the state - CCTV and ANPR cameras, drones, dogs, mobile phone tracking and social media publicity campaigns, means the celebrities have to be creative to evade capture. programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil look back on two sets of couples who struggled to decide whether to stick to their roots or move on to pastures new. In Wandsworth, south London Rachel and Tim debated over city or country. While they both agreed their 1930s semi was too small for their family of four, how to move forward was their issue. In Lincoln, Carly and Eric had a similar situation with their two-bed bungalow being too small for them and their family and while Eric thought their only choice was to move, Carly was adamant she wouldn't leave her close family support network behind

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets retired racehorse breeder John and his wife Helen in Dunstable. The couple met at Newbury races in 2005 and wed two years later, living together in a 17th-century farmhouse until illness struck in 2018. Helen had a catastrophic stroke, severely affecting her mobility and leaving her with aphasia, which affects her ability to communicate. Constrained by the steep stairs, narrow doorways and changes in level of their current home, John resolved to make a big change in their lives with the purchase of a nearby two-acre plot. Following the demolition of an old, dilapidated house on site, a new high-tech accessible pavilion, complete with wildlife garden, will be built in its place for £1.3million

programme.title: Rise and Fall

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Two-part special following the case of a naked man found stabbed to death in Luton, which leads police to discover this may be one of a series of murders in which men are lured with the promise of sex, so that they can be robbed. DI Dale Mepstead turns her attention to two men who are seen on CCTV accompanying the suspects into a flat. Will either of the women being held in custody reveal their identity?

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: When a man is found dead and completely naked after bleeding out from a stab wound to his thigh, Bedfordshire's Major Crime unit charge two women who they believe enticed the man into meeting them with the promise of sex, but instead had the intention of robbing him. CCTV reveals the women were accompanied by two men on the night of the murder. Now with four suspects in custody, investigators need to work out who is behind the 'honey trap' plot and which of their suspects is responsible for the murder

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: This episode focuses on a day at St George's during the global pandemic. Colin, 79, is rushed to the hospital after collapsing in his garage. Doctors are concerned that he has suffered a stroke, but he has also recently been diagnosed with a brain tumour. Tony is in minor injuries with crippling pain in his fingers. The 88-year-old reflects on his life, his love of dancing and how he believes the pandemic has brought out best in people

Edward VIII's abdication in 1936 meant that his brother 'Bertie' became King George VI, and his eldest daughter Elizabeth was now suddenly and unexpectedly heir to the throne. programme.desc: A radical re-telling of the events that lead to the Second World War, this time focusing on the period between March 1939 and September 1939. Fresh from invading Czechoslovakia, Hitler now turns his attention to his next target, Poland, and orders his army commanders to plan for the invasion. Despite Britain and France making it clear that they would stand by Poland, Hitler decided to invade regardless on September 1, 1939, an act of aggression that triggered the start of the Second World War

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Advanced clinical practitioner Chantelle orders an urgent CT scan to assess whether 79-year-old John has sustained any brain damage after falling at home and cracking his head. To complicate matters, John has a large cancerous growth on his cheek that has also been caught during the fall

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: An urgent call leads to a multi-vehicle pursuit to rescue a child, as PC Ian Cosgrove tracks down the suspect on the M6 - but is the driver alone? In Cheshire, a vehicle with suspected links to organised crime has been seized and PC Amy Hollis is called in to escort it safely back to HQ., while in Ellesmere Port, PC Chris Swash is on the hunt for a car with cloned plates

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: An officer responds to reports of a break-in at a garage and prepares for the possibility that the suspect is still there. When he does spot a suspicious-looking man, he must make a split-second decision about whether to tackle him or not. Officers receive a call about a fight with a knife and when they arrive at the scene, they discover a trail of blood leading into a block of flats

programme.title: Never Teach Your Wife to Drive
programme.desc: Documentary following three women who are learning how to drive under instruction from their partners, with the drama and mayhem of the lessons putting added strain on their relationships. In Hertfordshire, Becky's tendency to put her foot down on the accelerator and severe lack of spatial awareness leaves Greg stressed out, while John begins by taking Yasmin out for endless spins around a car park in Wigan. In Guisborough, North Yorkshire, Matt's high levels of patience are tested as he teaches his hot-tempered wife Yaveli the rules of the road

programme.title: Fireman Sam

Elsewhere, a Jack Russell with strong reactions to traffic makes going for a walk a potentially lethal experience, and two akitas have an aggressive dislike of all other dogs, which the owners fear may turn violent

programme.desc: Featuring a Top Ten Guide to Living in Benidorm on the Cheap, revealing that life as a budget expat is possible for almost any pocket, before catching up with some of the big characters from the season. Scouse singer Eddie, Essex campsite worker Dean and Wigan granny Maria explain where to find super-cheap digs, and how to turn a caravan into a home with all mod cons

programme.title: Motorhoming with Merton & Webster
programme.desc: Paul Merton and Suki Webster explore Snowdonia and pitch up at Lake Bala, where they meet a couple who have converted an old horsebox into a family-sized motorhome. Paul and Sue sample some of the many watersports available, starting with paddle boarding and ending with a little synchronised swimming. The following day they're off to the Mach Loop valley - a famous flight path for the RAF fighter pilot training at nearby Anglesey

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Isle of Wight: Jewel of the South
programme.desc: Following more of the residents who live and work on the Isle of Wight, and exploring how the locals cope with the challenges of a busy tourist season. Alan Titchmarsh narrates

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Live: Vanished: The Hunt for Britain's Missing People
programme.desc: Every 90 seconds someone is reported missing in the UK. Most are found within hours, many are located in a matter of days but there are some who seem to disappear, often with little or no trace. Dan Walker investigates people who have gone missing - some cases well known, others not, and each with a unique set of circumstances. Dan speaks directly to loved ones, families, friends, police and experts from charities

programme.title: Predator: Catching the Black Cab Rapist
programme.desc: Documentary examining the investigation into serial rapist John Worboys, who attacked more than 100 victims in his taxi between 2000 and 2008. With access to some of his victims, and the police team that finally cracked the case once flaws in the original investigation emerged, this film's new analysis of the facts explains why it took years before Worboys's long and violent campaign of terror against women was finally brought to an end

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: A corpse found in a ditch by a dog walker in 2013 became the first in a series of dead bodies discovered, kick-starting a police investigation to track down a serial killer

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the UK to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Egypt's Great Treasures with Bettany Hughes
programme.desc: In this three-part documentary, the professor takes viewers on a beautiful, bespoke journey across this dramatic country, presenting her top 10 treasures of Egypt

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sam and Station Officer Steele take the kids to the beach, but Lily gets stranded out at sea and they have to call Elvis to rescue her

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder and the pups need to transport an ice-cream cake up to Jake's cabin as a surprise for his birthday

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go sailing with Grandpa Pig, but he keeps getting the boat stuck in the mud. They all decide to have a sleepover on the boat while they wait for the tide to come back in

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: Bugles in the Afternoon (1952)
programme.desc: A disgraced cavalryman tries to redeem himself by returning to active service at a fort in the middle of Sioux territory, unaware the commanding officer is an arch-enemy from the past. Antagonism grows as they both fall for the same woman, and the newcomer finds himself assigned to ever more dangerous missions by his commander, who hopes he will fail to return from them. Western, with Ray Milland, Helena Carter and Hugh Marlowe

programme.title: Cowboy (1958)
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk befriends a visiting cowboy and soon talks his way into joining him on a cattle drive so he can impress the woman he loves. The tenderfoot has no idea of what awaits him as he ventures out into the Wild West, an experience that forces him to undergo a dramatic change. Western, starring Jack Lemmon, Glenn Ford, Anna Kashfi and Brian Donlevy

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton (1957)
programme.desc: Lord Loam is proud of his tendency to treat his staff as equals - to a point - while his manservant Crichton believes people should know their place. However, when the entire household is shipwrecked on a desert island, it is the resourceful butler who rises to the top of the pecking order - to the horror of his supposedly liberal master. Comedy based on JM Barrie's play, starring Kenneth More, Cecil Parker, Diane Cilento and Peter Graves

programme.title: Finding Your Feet (2017)
programme.desc: A wealthy woman's privileged existence is shattered when she discovers her husband is having an affair with her best friend. Seeking solace, she turns to her estranged sister, who lives in a London council estate, and finds a new lease of life in joining her community dance class. Comedy, starring Imelda Staunton, Celia Imrie, Timothy Spall and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: The Banshees of Inisherin Interview Special
programme.desc: The In Bruges team of Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson and writer/director Martin McDonagh talk about making their new film together, The Banshees of Inisherin

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle (2017)
programme.desc: Four teenagers play a jungle-themed game on an old console, only to find themselves transported into the game and transformed into its heroic characters. They must embark on a death-defying journey through the game's wilderness setting to make it back to the real world, or be stuck as video game characters forever. Fantasy action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

programme.title: Anchorman 2: The Legend Continues (2013)
programme.desc: Arrogant newsreader Ron Burgundy's career is rescued from a drunken slump by an executive for a new 24-hour news channel. Reassembling his team of sidekicks, he swiftly rises from the network's graveyard to become its biggest star with a run of ludicrously sensationalist broadcasts. Comedy sequel, starring Will Ferrell, Christina Applegate, Paul Rudd and Steve Carell

programme.title: Triple 9 (2016)
programme.desc: A gang of corrupt cops who carry out bank robberies under the noses of their law-abiding colleagues are blackmailed into carrying out a seemingly impossible heist by the Russian Mob. They realise the only way to carry out the crime is to kill a police officer as a diversion. Crime thriller, starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, Casey Affleck, Kate Winslet and Woody Harrelson

programme.title: Dragoon Wells Massacre (1957)
programme.desc: A cavalry officer is assigned to escort a captured murderer to prison. However, the prisoner and his guard are compelled to join forces to survive when Apache warriors raid their wagon train as it moves across Arizona into hostile territory. Western, starring Barry Sullivan, Dennis O'Keefe, Mona Freeman and Katy Jurado

programme.title: Hangman's Knot (1952)
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers wipe out a group of Union troops carrying a shipment of gold, but later learn the Civil War ended the month before, rendering their attack a criminal act. The soldiers go on the run with the loot, but their worries deepen when they are besieged by bandits. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Lee Marvin and Richard Denning

programme.title: Billion Dollar Brain (1967)
programme.desc: Former secret agent Harry Palmer comes out of retirement to take a mysterious canister to Finland, and ends up embroiled in an American megalomaniac's bid to take over the world. Espionage thriller, directed by Ken Russell and starring Michael Caine, Oscar Homolka and Karl Malden

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle (2016)
programme.desc: Biopic of British sporting underdog Eddie Edwards. Determined to fulfil his dreams of becoming an Olympic athlete, Edwards trains as a ski jumper - a field in which Britain had no other competitors. He secures a place in the 1988 Winter Olympics, where his can-do attitude makes him a media sensation in the face of a losing streak. Starring Taron Egerton, Hugh Jackman and Christopher Walken

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still (2008)
programme.desc: An alien arrives on Earth, accompanied by an awesomely powerful robot, on a fateful mission - to decide if the human race deserves to continue - and if not, to wipe it out. The visitor is imprisoned in a military facility, but a scientist helps him escape, hoping to prove that mankind is worth saving. Sci-fi drama remake, starring Keanu Reeves and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: Resistance (2020)
programme.desc: Aspiring mime artist Marcel Marceau joins the French Resistance to save the lives of thousands of children orphaned at the hands of the Nazis, including Klaus Barbie, also known as The Butcher of Lyon. Writer/director Jonathan Jakubowicz's biopic, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Clemence Poesy and Matthias Schweighofer

programme.title: Swallow (2019)
programme.desc: Hunter Conrad appears to live a charmed life, with a good husband, a beautiful home and a baby on the way. But as she struggles to meet her controlling family's expectations, she finds herself increasingly compelled to consume dangerous objects, and must confront the dark secret behind her new obsession. Thriller, starring Haley Bennett and Austin Stowell

programme.title: Rosemary's Baby (1968)
programme.desc: A couple move into a new apartment, and the husband forms a close friendship with their elderly neighbours. The wife soon becomes pregnant, and starts to suspect her spouse has been seduced into a Satanic cult, who have sinister plans for her baby. Roman Polanski's horror, based on the novel by Ira Levin, and starring Mia Farrow, John Cassavetes, Oscar-winner Ruth Gordon, Sidney Blackmer and Ralph Bellamy

programme.title: Arizona Raiders (1965)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army (1960)
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully

programme.title: Run Silent, Run Deep (1958)
programme.desc: A commander aboard a US Navy submarine has a titanic clash of egos with his second in command as the senior officer's obsession with sinking as many enemy vessels as possible, whatever the risk, spirals out of control. Second World War drama, starring Clark Gable, Burt Lancaster, Jack Warden, Brad Dexter and Don Rickles

programme.title: The Man in the White Suit (1951)
programme.desc: A put-upon chemist's invention of an indestructible dirt-proof fibre brings him into conflict with clothing industry moguls who foresee their profits disappearing down the drain - and promptly vow to put a stop to his plans. Satirical Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood, Cecil Parker and Michael Gough

programme.title: Sahara (2005)
programme.desc: An explorer stumbles upon evidence that an American Civil War battleship, which was laden with treasure when it sank without trace, has ended up somewhere in the Sahara. However, he is deflected from his mercenary quest to find the hoard by an encounter with a tenacious doctor, whose battle to stop the spread of a deadly disease could be linked to his own mission. Adventure, starring Matthew McConaughey, Penelope Cruz and Steve Zahn

programme.title: The Spy Who Dumped Me (2018)
programme.desc: Two friends are thrust into the middle of an international conspiracy when one of them discovers the ex-boyfriend who broke up with her by text message is really a CIA agent on the run from a team of assassins. The revelation sends them on a death-defying journey across Europe with the fate of the world at stake. Comedy, starring Mila Kunis, Kate McKinnon, Sam Heughan and Gillian Anderson

programme.title: The Death of Dick Long (2019)
programme.desc: Three friends gather for what is supposed to be a band practice, but when one of them is badly hurt while they are messing around, it falls to his gormless mates to help him - with disastrous results. Comedy directed by and starring Daniel Scheinert (co-helmer of Oscar-winner Everything Everywhere All at Once), with Michael Abbott Jnr and Andre Hyland

programme.title: Saint Frances (2019)
programme.desc: Bridget takes the agonising decision to end an unwanted pregnancy before she becomes a nanny in an affluent suburb of Chicago. She is hired by Annie and Maya to take care of their bright and rambunctious six-year-old daughter, Frances, with life-changing results. Comedy drama, starring Kelly O'Sullivan

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A helpless Diane struggles to convince Tony to seek help, Rayne proceeds with her attempts to make Prince a 'viral hit', and Nancy is in need of a miracle

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to West Nyack, New York, to come to the aid of a family-run Mexican restaurant that is suffering a financial crisis, and a case of hard-headed patriarchy. When the chef arrives he finds himself turfing out the existing customers for their own safety due to a cockroach infestation on the premises

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to the upmarket quarter of Hollywood to help the owner of failing health-food restaurant Sante La Brea. As well as struggling to control his disrespectful staff, the proprietor receives a surprise visit from the police at the height of dinner service

programme.desc: After the repairs are completed in Amy's flat, she lies to Sheldon by telling him that the work is still ongoing so they can carry on living together for a while longer. Leonard is upset when he finds out Penny has been moving his collectibles out of Sheldon's old room and into storage behind his back

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch reluctantly lets his distressed colleague Brenda stay the night, Phil and Claire think Alex has let her imagination run wild after she tells them she has a boyfriend, and Jay hits a Manny-shaped obstacle while trying to get out of accompanying Gloria to a party. Kirsten Johnston (3rd Rock from the Sun) guest stars, with Jesse Tyler Ferguson, Ty Burrell, Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley turns 21, so the adults hit a bar, where Claire is desperate to appear more of a pal than a nagging, uptight mum, and Cameron and Mitchell are distressed when their 'cool' credentials come up short. Phil and Jay's quick pitstop to buy a present takes a disastrous turn, too, while back at home, Alex, Manny and Luke are left to babysit Lily

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The team visits Boyle's beach house on a detectives-only getaway, but Peralta ruins the fun by inviting Captain Holt along. The host helps Diaz to send romantic texts to her new boyfriend Marcus, while Gina amuses herself by trying to get Santiago drunk. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta faces paying back all the money he has borrowed from his colleagues over the years, and goes to great lengths to keep a secret about Sergeant Jeffords. Santiago and Captain Holt team up to reopen the Brooklyn Broiler arson case

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's obsession with gift-giving etiquette annoys his friends as Christmas approaches. Meanwhile, Leonard is thrilled to meet an award-winning scientist, only to be filled with jealousy when his new colleague takes an interest in Penny. With guest star Michael Trucco (Battlestar Galactica, One Tree Hill)

programme.desc: Sheldon and the gang are excited when Barry Kripke challenges them to a robot duel. Meanwhile, Howard is devastated when Penny finally tells him what she thinks of his chauvinism. Guest starring John Ross Bowie

programme.desc: Amy is furious when she learns that Sheldon has shared intimate details of their relationship with his colleagues at the university, prompting their first fight since moving in together. Raj considers trying to live without financial support from his father, who thinks he is spoilt

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Cut off from his father's fortune, Raj struggles to balance his books, so decides to appoint Sheldon to organise his finances and get him out of debt. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con because she thinks Leonard wants her to come along

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Bad moods must be catching when Phil and Jay spend the afternoon together. Meanwhile, Gloria teaches Haley how to stand up to her boss. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: While Alex goes head-to-head with a school rival, Gloria prepares for her US citizenship test, only to be thrown off her game by Javier. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households - a man who struggles to keep up with his younger wife, an embarrassing husband and a gay couple getting used to parenthood after adopting a Vietnamese baby. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Holt begins to worry he is being set up for a fall by one of his superiors, and Peralta is handed the chance to work on an important case. Meanwhile, Jeffords tries to make sure his twins get a place at their chosen school. Comedy, with Andy Samberg and Terry Crews

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Santiago go undercover as an engaged couple in a bid to catch an identity thief, and find that the investigation brings them closer together. Meanwhile, Boyle organises a surprise birthday party for Rosa. Comedy, with Andy Samberg and Melissa Fumero

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard finds out that he has a half-brother, Sheldon and Amy have a platonic sleepover, and Penny gets an offer to audition for a Kevin Smith film. American comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.desc: Raj is asked to create a message on the off-chance a Nasa mission discovers alien life, and the guys fight over what he should do. Meanwhile, Penny contemplates returning to acting. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Stuart takes Penny out for a second date, during which she drunkenly reveals her true feelings. programme.desc: Sheldon wins a grant to pay for a summer expedition to the North Pole, and invites his friends to join him. However, the gang's imminent departure causes Leonard and Penny to reconsider their feelings for each other. Johnny Gale and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.desc: With his parents recently divorced, privately educated Will has to move to a new area and make friends at the local comprehensive, where he meets Simon, Jay and Neil. First episode of the comedy, starring Simon Bird, Joe Thomas, James Buckley and Blake Harrison

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The four lads decide to play truant from sixth form and buy alcohol for an all-day drinking session, which is interrupted when Neil's father comes home early. Meanwhile, Simon decides to declare his love for Carli through graffiti, and the friends face the wrath of their parents

Six-foot pansexual opera singer Clare is looking for a man as tall as she is, while Jessica, who has a disastrous dating history, hopes to bring out her naughty side

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Essex boy Bradley, who hasn't been on a date in more than a decade, is paired with assertive Lucy, an architect from Manchester. Next through the door is Ann-Marie, celebrating her 50th birthday. Having survived four bouts of cancer, she believes time is precious and that love is the most important thing. Her evening gets off to a good start when cleaning company owner Carl arrives with a surprise present. Self-confessed serial dater Mitz considers himself a pro, but his unusual technique - involving telling lies - threatens to derail his meeting with Sarah

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: New couples Rupert and Evelyn, and Hugo and Tayla enter the experiment. Rupert's nerves get the better of him, and Tayla may not even make it down the aisle

programme.title: Fred's Last Resort

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam struggles to balance his old friendships with his new ones. Beverly realises that she wants an adult relationship with her kids

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Grand Designs

But the plot they have bought, near a beautiful estuary in West Sussex, is dominated by a swampy pond that they are unable to fill in. Instead, they plan to make it central to their design, turning the pond into a biodiverse waterscape, and then floating their house above it. programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Bedfordshire Police around the clock as they investigate a number of major crimes. A man emerges from a hotel lift covered in blood and holding a fire extinguisher, before approaching the reception desk and shouting that he has killed someone. Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene

programme.title: 9/11: 102 Minutes That Changed America
programme.desc: Amateur footage and audiotape recorded by people around New York, giving an insight into their experiences of the September 11 terrorist attacks on the World Trade Centre in 2001. The duration of the tragedy, from the first plane hitting the north tower to the collapse of both buildings, was 102 minutes. During that time, many of the city's residents sought to preserve images of what was taking place. Joined together into a single, seamless historical record, the end result is an intensely personal perspective on events as they unfolded

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-year-old motorcyclist Michelle is rushed to A&E after crashing head first into a lamp-post, with scans revealing that she has broken bones in her neck, arm and shoulder and requires emergency surgery. Timothy, 69, arrives at St George's after riding his bicycle into the back of a parked ambulance, while 33-year-old expectant mother Eleanor is admitted after cutting her thumb on a meat cleaver

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Bedfordshire Police around the clock as they investigate a number of major crimes. A man emerges from a hotel lift covered in blood and holding a fire extinguisher, before approaching the reception desk and shouting that he has killed someone. Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and Chris Addison taking on Joe Wilkinson and Katherine Ryan. David O'Doherty joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp enters the single-cake class at the Devon County Show, and hopes to win over the judges with her own Caribbean-inspired recipe. However, it is a fellow competitor's beetroot cake that ends up raising their eyebrows

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lynn and Gerald are looking for a holiday home in the north of Spain's Murcia region, where they can enjoy the Mediterranean sunshine and numerous golf courses the area has to offer. Ben Hillman lines up five options within their budget of £100,000, hoping at least one will encourage the pair to make an offer

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A Berkshire couple running a Spanish cycling company that has been affected by the pandemic try to attract custom closer to home, and two gîte owners tackle a big renovation

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in Wales, where they pick up and restore a dentist's table and a barber's chair, and make a coffee table out of parquet flooring

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel around Britain to find items to fix up and flog on to make a profit for their owners. In the Cotswolds, the duo compete to see who can create the most profit on two old lamps and take a spin in a Devonshire fire engine

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers investigate the case of Evelyn Burgum, who was thought to have emigrated to Canada with her husband George, but may have been living in north London all along. The case of 82-year-old Betty Littlewood proves difficult for the team when it emerges she was an illegitimate child. Plus, details of three more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition kicks off at Woodleys Farmhouse in Woburn Sands, Buckinghamshire, where the inexperienced owner worries that breakfast will be her downfall

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eddie and Karen Deighton host their rivals at Finch Cottage in Wilsford cum Lake, Wiltshire. They pride themselves on providing a personal experience, but the lack of TVs in the rooms is a big turn-off for some guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third destination is the Bell Inn in Thorpe-le-Soken, Essex, where hospitality manager Ian Hawthorne and his fiancee Karen Hunt are confident they can satisfy their guests. But Frankie is less than pleased by the view from her room and one pair of guests are still in a bad mood over their feedback earlier in the week

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sisters Georgie Monaghan and Frankie Gallie's Frasers Guest House in Battlesbridge, Essex, is the final stop of the week's competition. Frasers boasts a unique location in an antiques district, but some guests are left questioning whether the mattresses are heirlooms too when they discover a few unappealing stains. After spending the day exploring an antiques yard, Georgie and Frankie treat their guests to milkshakes at their family-run diner. Talk soon turns to payment day, making for a tense end to the evening

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last day of the competition sees the B&Bers eager to challenge each other about the feedback they've received, as Toni from Woodleys Farmhouse wants to know how she can improve her breakfast service. When one pair accuses another of game playing, things start to get emotional before the winning B&B is announced.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house-hunting around Brighton and Hove, where Phil helps young first-time buyers Charlie and Katy. The pair have lived with Katy's mother in Fiveways, but their budget means they may have to compromise on location in their new home. Meanwhile, Kirstie is hunting for a new flat for Dani, who wants to put down fresh roots after renting for the past 12 months

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer travel to Cowbridge in Wales to help a couple who have a home that, on the surface, looks perfect - it's big, beautiful and in a picturesque location. But a long list of gripes, including a dysfunctional layout, has made Amy long for pastures new. However, having inherited the property from Louis's grandmother, it holds a special place in his heart and he is not ready to give up on it just yet

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Billy, Gwendoline and Michael locate their heating problem, but it means that Billy - who's scared of height - has to repoint the chimney 20 metres up. Clive and Tanith get their hands dirty trying to work out what's stopped the fountain working at their hotel and Michelin-starred restaurant. Meanwhile, the clock's ticking for sisters Marian and Tanya as they try to sort out a winter's worth of problems

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of musician Toby Leeming as he sets out to build a house wrapped around an ancient oak tree in rural Suffolk. The design for Toby's five-building home contains six bedrooms, six bathrooms, a music studio and an annexe - a vast project more like a village than a house. Creating this life changing vision on a £530k budget, and in only eight months, will not be an easy task, especially as they must build up close to an ancient oak without destroying any of the roots

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Liam, 31, is rushed to St George's after collapsing at home after his fourth epileptic seizure of the day, and he experiences another at the hospital, while 89-year-old Mair is brought to A&E with severe chest pain and difficulty breathing and doctors take blood samples to test whether her symptoms are due to pneumonia. Twelve-year-old Lauren arrives by ambulance after breaking her leg while scoring a try in a rugby match and she needs extensive surgery to give her the best chance of walking normally again

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the demands placed on the women and men who answer people's cries for help. As an ambulance crew answers a call to a heart attack, call handlers guide the victim's daughter through administering CPR. A nine-year-old boy is coached through a terrifying situation when his mother suffers a diabetic emergency while driving, and a father-to-be is instructed how to deliver his baby over the phone

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Seventy-one-year-old Tony is rushed to A&E by air ambulance after falling head first onto a tiled floor while doing DIY in his kitchen. Meanwhile, 23-year-old Charlie's facial injuries are treated after he was assaulted on his way home from a night out. A 10-year-old girl, Lucy, arrives at St George's after having seizures for the past 48 hours

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Crewmates Rob Moore and Ally Shipway rush to a dramatic car crash. The driver of the car is arrested for drink-driving. Jan Vann and Chelsie Kennedy treat a 93-year-old war veteran who has fallen and may also have a life-threatening infection. Paramedics Peter Bowles and Manoj Summan treat a man who may have had a stroke. They also rush to a four-year-old who is pale and vomiting and needs to be seen by specialists right away

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett taking on Sean Lock and Michelle Wolf. Adam Riches joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Liam, 31, is rushed to St George's after collapsing at home after his fourth epileptic seizure of the day, and he experiences another at the hospital, while 89-year-old Mair is brought to A&E with severe chest pain and difficulty breathing and doctors take blood samples to test whether her symptoms are due to pneumonia. Twelve-year-old Lauren arrives by ambulance after breaking her leg while scoring a try in a rugby match and she needs extensive surgery to give her the best chance of walking normally again

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team revisits favourite investigations, including Kate Quilton's visit to the world's largest producer of jelly beans to find out what goes into the sweets. Matt Tebbutt attempts to find out why tinned anchovies taste so salty, and Jimmy Doherty heads to a Mauritius distillery as he explores the secrets of rum

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Ross Noble: Freewheeling
programme.desc: The comedian heads to Scotland on his latest mission, where his efforts to avoid cliches surrounding the country surprisingly land him a part in a Braveheart-style film, where he runs away from the Krankies and the Loch Ness Monster in the style of 'Trainspotting'

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: Customs officers rescue a man from the sea at night after he falls from a smuggler's boat, and the Drug Squad raid a suspected dealer's house

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Britain's most talented detectives pursue a violent drug gang in Gloucester, an aggressive mugger in sleepy Kent, and a gang of men stealing Britain's history in Cheshire

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: A mix of newcomers and returning heroes take to the course, including rugby league legend Paul Gallen, miracle mum Tash Sergi, and a Ninja favourite in tradesman Sam Goodall

programme.title: Rick Stein's Road to Mexico
programme.desc: Rick's journey draws to a close as he heads east from Oaxaca to the Yucatan Peninsula, where dishes like Papadzules and Sikil Pak are enjoyed in villages across the countryside. Here, locals feast on the hottest chilli of them all, the Habanero. Rick ends his journey feasting on grilled seafood in Tulum, along the shores of the Caribbean Sea

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Police in Western Australia conduct a two-day drug-dealing operation that exposes one suspect's ownership of a large number of dogs in poor condition.

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: Customs officers spring into action after news of a sinking boat - on land, Sergeant Steve uses good old-fashioned leg work to track down two stolen scooters

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturer's already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are in Russia as the motoring magazine returns, taking part in a race across the urban landscape of St Petersburg. James defends the honour of the car in a very small Renault, Richard tries to prove that pedalling is faster by riding a bicycle, while Jeremy attempts to demonstrate that water is the quickest way across town by piloting a hovercraft. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. Plus, the new Lamborghini Huracan is put through its paces and singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran takes to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters embark on a road trip across Australia's Northern Territory in fast, luxurious GT cars, with Jeremy Clarkson choosing a BMW M6 Gran Coupe, Richard Hammond picking a Bentley Continental GT V8 and James May opting for a Nissan GT-R. The trio set out on an adventure that takes in crocodile-infested rivers, a race around a vast opencast mine and an encounter with one of the world's longest lorries, concluding with an unusual challenge involving a farm, their cars and 4,000 cows.
