programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress heads to the island of Shikoku hoping to gain a better understanding of Japanese Buddhism. She then takes a bullet train to another island - Kyushu - where she finds the Henn Na Hotel, the world's first robot hotel. At Nagasaki, she visits Shiroyama Elementary school, one of the only buildings to survive the atomic bomb dropped on the city in 1945. Joanna then travels to Sakurajima, one of the country's most active volcanoes, before heading to the islands of Okinawa where one of the bloodiest battles of the Second World War was fought

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook, Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the country to discover how the railways have affected people and communities, and the legacy they have left behind. He begins in Manchester, where he finds out how the world's first industrialised city produced a revolutionary political movement, and learns about the railway workers who founded one of the most successful football clubs of all time. Along the way, the presenter does the washing in Port Sunlight - a model village on the Wirral - and hears stories about the aptly named George Francis Train's time in Birkenhead, Merseyside

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England in the elegant resort town of Southport, where the railways provided thousands of holidaymakers with the chance enjoy the fun of the fair. On his journey around some of the region's larger towns, the presenter uncovers the history of Victorian entrepreneurship in Wigan and the beginnings of the Industrial Revolution in Bolton, before heading to smaller Leyland to get behind the wheel of a 100-year-old commercial vehicle

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: The actress embarks on her third travelogue, having previously traced the Nile from its source and sampled the varied rural, historical and urban cultures of Greece. This time, she sets out to travel 6,400 miles making use of the Trans-Siberian Railway, which is considered the longest railway line in the world. Joanna's journey begins in Hong Kong, where she spent some of her childhood. She takes a bullet train to Beijing, where she meets a woman who claims to have known the last Chinese emperor's favourite concubine, and officially joins the Trans-Siberian track. From there, she travels to the Great Wall, and takes an overnight train into Mongolia via the Gobi desert

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England by celebrating Victorian trade with the Preston Guild, and then heading to Rochdale to learn about a pioneering movement to improve the lives of working families. The presenter also follows in the tracks of many 19th-century industrial employees who made day trips to Hebden Bridge to walk in the Calder Valley

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses into West Yorkshire to begin the next leg of his journey, visiting the Worth Valley and the home of the three Bronte sisters, who were early investors in the railway industry. He then heads to Oakworth to find out how its station and tracks were used in one of the most popular films ever made, and in Bradford discovers the ways in which 19th-century workers saved to buy a home. The presenter finishes in Halifax, where he learns how the railways contributed to the town's success

programme.desc: The actress reaches the midway point of her 6,000-mile journey from Hong Kong to Moscow via the Trans-Siberian Railway, taking in the varied sights of Mongolia. She also heads to the nation's capital, Ulan Bator, where she tracks down the famous Mongolian throat-singers, before catching a train bound for Russia. programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc: Comedians James Acaster and Ed Gamble, Strictly dancer Katya Jones, Olympic snowboarder Aimee Fuller, actors Nicola Thorp and Nikesh Patel, mathematician Bobby Seagull, social media star Saffron Barker and TV therapists Nik and Eva Speakman go on the run across mainland UK while an elite team of police and military personnel try to track them down. The hunters being armed with the powers of the state - CCTV and ANPR cameras, drones, dogs, mobile phone tracking and social media publicity campaigns, means the celebrities have to be creative to evade capture. As the competitors escape from Shrewsbury prison and go on the run, the hunters are instantly on their tails, tracking them with CCTV cameras and a helicopter. programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets retired racehorse breeder John and his wife Helen in Dunstable. The couple met at Newbury races in 2005 and wed two years later, living together in a 17th-century farmhouse until illness struck in 2018. Helen had a catastrophic stroke, severely affecting her mobility and leaving her with aphasia, which affects her ability to communicate. Constrained by the steep stairs, narrow doorways and changes in level of their current home, John resolved to make a big change in their lives with the purchase of a nearby two-acre plot. Following the demolition of an old, dilapidated house on site, a new high-tech accessible pavilion, complete with wildlife garden, will be built in its place for £1.3million

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits a couple who took on the task of constructing a sustainable two-storey timber house in the Kent countryside, heated by glass panels. Mimi da Costa managed the project despite a lack of experience, while her husband Andre worked and looked after the children, intending to have it completed in 16 weeks. But as the complex build threatened to drag on for months, it became unclear whether their home would succeed in blending into the landscape and provide them with a greener, healthier lifestyle

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses

Programmes appraised include The Watcher, I Can See Your Voice, Love Is Blind, Only Connect, personal stories in Channel 4's Stand Up to Cancer strand, and ITV News coverage on the transition of power in Downing Street to Rishi Sunak

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin compete, the intrepid players hoping to become the 15th Taskmaster champion. In this episode, Jenny dances around a giant golden pineapple in a wedding dress, while Frankie discovers why cats love balls of string so much. Greg's 'Admiral of Admin' Alex Horne helps maintain order amid the chaos

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Two-part special following the case of a naked man found stabbed to death in Luton, which leads police to discover this may be one of a series of murders in which men are lured with the promise of sex, so that they can be robbed. DI Dale Mepstead turns her attention to two men who are seen on CCTV accompanying the suspects into a flat. Will either of the women being held in custody reveal their identity?

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: When a man is found dead and completely naked after bleeding out from a stab wound to his thigh, Bedfordshire's Major Crime unit charge two women who they believe enticed the man into meeting them with the promise of sex, but instead had the intention of robbing him. CCTV reveals the women were accompanied by two men on the night of the murder. Now with four suspects in custody, investigators need to work out who is behind the 'honey trap' plot and which of their suspects is responsible for the murder

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: A crack team of Britain's top specialist trainers instructs beleaguered owners in dog management skills and dog psychology. Ferocious cockapoo Bear is driving a wedge between owners Paul and Louise. With their marriage under stress, Victoria and Adam must help tame Bear's aggressive behaviour before it's too late. Eleven-year-old Chihuahua Gina is a pocket rocket with an attitude problem. Because of her penchant for attacking other dogs, mum and son Cindy and Cory have to carry her around in a special zipped-up safety bag. It remains to be seen whether the trainers can teach an old dog new tricks

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests rifle through the feedback, from Meg and Yvonne's lavatory let-down to Nyoami's fiddled French toast. Meanwhile, Meg wants to know why her tea tray wasn't everyone's cup of tea. After the hosts have debated their differences, the payments are revealed and the week's winner is announced

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: This edition focuses on officers cracking down on abuse, trafficking and exploitation In York, Sgt Mick leads early morning raids on two men suspected of exploiting and intimidating young teenage girls through the production of explicit images and videos, while Sgt Julian discovers seven illegal immigrants in the back of a lorry at Wetherby services recently arrived from the continent

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Cameras follow a high-speed police interception unit at work in Durham and Cleveland, including Jack Hamilton dealing with a roadside dispute that has spiralled out of control, and a stand-off between armed officers and a man wielding a knife. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The high-speed police interception unit opens the door of a drug farm and assists with an emergency landing at Durham Tees Valley Airport. Plus, Jimmy Grieves catches a thief in the act and Darren Cawthorne deals with a driver who is causing problems

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Kev Salter and Ian Squire hunt for a man roaming the late-night streets with a machete, while the driver of a Ford Fiesta takes a pursuit off-road. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Cote de Pablo

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony and Ziva track a suspected terrorist to a warehouse, where they find traces of radioactive metal - together with evidence suggesting a nuclear attack is being planned on Washington, DC. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An unfinished building is demolished when a bomb is detonated on-site, killing a 12-year-old boy. Logan and Briscoe call on the construction company, and their suspicions fall on a bankrupt contractor and a jealous husband. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Logan and Briscoe deal with a double homicide when an abused alcoholic breaks into his parents' former home and murders the current occupants. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the deaths of a radio DJ and a naval officer who were both killed during a live broadcast, only to discover there are a number of potential suspects. Evidence leads the agents to suspect the involvement of a radical group called Military at Home, prompting Tony to investigate an upmarket gated community - where his door-to-door inquiries yield an enticing proposition or two from the female residents. American drama, starring Michael Weatherly, with Nadia Bjorlin

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby becomes personally involved in the case of a murdered naval scientist who she regards as a kindred spirit. The team's initial inquiries turn up little concrete information about the victim's life, but the forensic specialist makes a breakthrough when she decodes some of the mysterious markings covering the body. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team members are surprised when Gibbs asks DiNozzo's father to join them in their investigation of a murder committed at the US Naval Academy. However, Tony Sr's experience turns out to play a vital role in the inquiry, which finds the team members hunting for a missing nuclear weapon they suspect is about to be sold on the black market. Guest starring Robert Wagner

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A woman's disappearance from a car park bears the hallmarks of a previous case in which the victim was killed 36 hours after being reported missing. The agents must work quickly to prevent the same thing happening again and their investigation leads them to uncover strange rituals and an unidentified subject with terrifying attachment issues

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: An autistic child is discovered splattered with blood, and the investigation reveals that someone must have shot his father and abducted his mother. Morgan and the team set about tracking down the missing parents, but only have the child's vague clues and inside information from his aunt to go on. Guest starring Romy Rosemont (Glee)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team traces an abandoned baby back to a college student who claims she was raped and did not realise she was pregnant. However, her story is thrown into doubt when the team discovers this is not the first time she has been suspected of dumping a newborn

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The murder of a successful lawyer who moonlighted as a stripper leads Benson and Stabler to her secret lover - but the death of a second woman, who was seemingly killed in similar circumstances, raises the possibility that their suspect is being framed. Guest starring Rebecca De Mornay, with Mariska Hargitay and Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The trial of an alleged rapist is brought to an abrupt halt by the death of his accuser, who claimed he had made her pregnant - and subsequent developments suggest the accusations may have been false. Detective drama, starring Mariska Hargitay, Christopher Meloni and Dann Florek

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: Liz's fate hangs in the balance when she is questioned in court about the harbourmaster's murder, and Red realises the only way to clear her name is to track down Tom. With time running out, he goes to extreme lengths to locate the next target on his list - the man who trained Tom to become a secret agent, and will know exactly where he's hiding

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: After new evidence proves Liz and Cooper lied under oath, Red and Ressler track down Liz's ex-husband Tom Keen in a bid to make him take the fall for Liz and the FBI in court. They find Tom in the middle of an arms deal in Dresden, Germany, and their plan to cut his ties to his new drugs ring backfires when a dramatic shootout threatens his life. Drama, starring James Spader and Megan Boone

programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Logan and Briscoe investigate the murder of a psychiatrist, and their inquiries lead them to suspect the killer is either the victim's former husband, her obstructive father or a patient with multiple personality disorder

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A gas attack occurs at a subway station, and investigations reveal it bears the hallmarks of a previous incident at a church. Briscoe and Curtis are joined by Baltimore detectives Bayliss and Pembleton, who hope to apprehend the prime suspect in both incidents

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a social worker, exposing a racket involving foster children. The resulting trial sees Paul Robinette place the system in the dock as he defends a black woman accused of kidnapping her baby from his adoptive parents. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman murdered while out jogging is found to be the spouse of a comedy club owner previously acquitted of killing his first wife. In order to secure a conviction, the team is forced to trace the part of a Colombian coin used in a subway. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ziva confronts her past when the team is ordered to protect her father, Mossad director Eli David, at a gathering of former heads of NCIS. The agents discover he is being targeted by terrorists who have hijacked a shipment of advanced weapons from the army. Drama, guest starring TJ Ramini and Michael Nouri, with Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. The safe house is attacked, leaving Vance in hospital and Eli missing, with his bodyguard Amit Hadar dead. The movements of all the Palestinians are accounted for at the time of the attack, making it unclear who was responsible, and Ziva suspects her Mossad replacement Liat is hiding something. Drama, starring Michael Nouri, Cote de Pablo, Rocky Carroll and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy officer scheduled to testify in a forthcoming murder trial goes missing after receiving a threat at the safe house where he was staying, and the deputy district attorney asks the NCIS agents to locate him. One of their few leads is a dead turkey Tony and McGee find in the man's fridge, so they take it to Ducky for an autopsy. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Jackie investigate the death of a wealthy woman, but the case takes an unusual turn when the victim's mentally ill daughter claims God told her that the killer was her stepfather. Meanwhile, Frank is asked to look into the past of his former parish priest, who has been recommended for canonisation. Guest starring Timothy Busfield (thirtysomething) and James Rebhorn (White Collar)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Two men are implicated in the rape and murder of a Canadian student, and the team finds enough evidence to have them charged - but the disappearance of the sole witness forces the judge to dismiss the case. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A student's body is found dumped in an area frequented by prostitutes, and it soon becomes clear she was deeply involved in the worlds of online gambling and high-stakes poker. As the investigation proceeds, Stabler and Tutuola find themselves on the trail of a famous American footballer and an undercover police officer. Hard-hitting drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Ice-T

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler investigates an assault case involving his former partner's teenage son, who assaulted a female friend during a drug-induced rage. However, the conflict between the detective's work and personal life pushes him to the verge of a breakdown and jeopardises the squad's reputation. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives examine the deaths of two gay men, both of whom were labelled as 'killers' by their murderer. Further investigation reveals the victims had an aggressive strain of HIV, leading the team to consider the possibility that the suspect is a vigilante operating in the interests of an Aids-awareness group. CCH Pounder guest stars, with BD Wong, Dann Florek and Diane Neal

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: Red announces his latest target is a scientist who is conducting a series of disturbing experiments in a bid to make himself immortal. programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Mardi Gras arrives in New Orleans, and Pride plans to mark the occasion by opening his bar to the public. However, festivities are put on immediate hold for the team when a US Marine is murdered at the hotel where Mayor Hamilton is holding his own party. As the agents head to the venue to investigate, they realise both Hamilton and Pride have disappeared. What follows is a race to locate the pair before they fall victim to their unknown kidnapper's brutal plans. Naval crime drama, starring Scott Bakula

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed at a US Navy construction site, and when the team realises a shipment of TNT has gone missing, a motive for murder in unveiled. Tracing the stolen explosives, Pride discovers a connection to a domestic drugs ring, but when he launches a sting, he is shocked to find Sonja among the dealers on-site. The agent reveals she is working undercover for DEA in an attempt to break the ring via her connection to the lead cocaine producer, Marion Watkins, who just happens to be her childhood friend. When the team finds out a toxic chemical has made its way into the gang's latest batch of cocaine, Sonja must appeal to Marion to do the right thing before people start dying. Crime drama, starring Scott Bakula and Shalita Grant

programme.desc: Chef Keith Floyd visits Argyll, where he prepares venison loin in blackcurrant liqueur and is shown how to pickle herrings, before leg of mutton with caper sauce is on the menu for the local laird. Later, Keith tries to catch a salmon for the man reputed to have been the inspiration behind Ian Fleming's James Bond character

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: Park Row (1952)
programme.desc: An ambitious reporter in 19th-century New York sets up his own newspaper, but his former boss will go to any lengths to rid herself of the competition. Drama, starring Gene Evans, Mary Welch and Bela Kovacs

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Mannering arranges to meet a stranger who has information about a valuable sword. Guest starring Edward Woodward

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes and Julie Graham as lonely hearts looking for love. Undertaker William Shawcross joins a dating agency in the hope of finding his ideal match, and is instantly attracted to put-upon midwife Mary Gilcrest - but she is less than keen to go on a date as she has her hands full with a mother-to-be suffering from a terminal illness. After a lacklustre first meeting, Mary agrees to see William again and a spark ignites between the fledgling couple - only for tragedy to strike when her patient dies, and the undertaker is called in to remove the body, revealing his unappealing occupation in the process. With Dominick Baron, Ricci Mcleod, Cheryl Campbell and Michael Begley

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six wakes to find himself back in London, but his delight is cut short by the realisation that his mind has been transported into the body of a scientist wanted by the Village authorities. Vintage drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: The Long Firm
programme.desc: Harry strikes up a friendship in prison with Lenny, a hippie Marxist lecturer who lands in hot water for teaching his theories on social deviance to the inmates of the maximum security wing. His course is shut down and Harry is moved to another jail, but the pair continue to communicate using a secret code to fox the authorities. Over the years, their relationship develops - until Lenny is horrified to read about a break-out at Brixton Prison

programme.title: Fascination (1979)
programme.desc: A thief seeks refuge in a grand castle, and is pleasantly surprised by the two beautiful women living there. However he soon realises his seductive hosts are addicted to drinking fresh human blood. French horror, starring Brigitte Lahaie, Franca Mai and Jean-Marie Lemaire

programme.title: United (2011)
programme.desc: Drama charting the story of the 'Busby Babes' - the Manchester United side who became the youngest-ever winners of the English Football League in 1956. Having won the league again in 1957, the team reaches the quarter-finals of the European Cup in 1958 - but disaster strikes as they return from the match in Belgrade, when their charter plane crashes following a refuelling stop in Munich. The disaster claims the lives of 23 people, including eight players - and with manager Matt Busby in a critical condition, coach Jimmy Murphy tries to rebuild the shattered team. Starring David Tennant, Jack O'Connell, Sam Claflin and Dougray Scott

programme.desc: Australian jockey Damien Oliver prepares to follow in his father's footsteps and compete in the 2002 Melbourne Cup. However, the weeks leading up to the event are rocked by tragedy for both Oliver himself, who faces a death in the family, and for the nation in the wake of the Bali bombings. Fact-based drama, starring Stephen Curry and Brendan Gleeson

programme.desc: A doctor tries to have a man who refused to allow his dying daughter to be given a blood transfusion prosecuted for manslaughter. Drama, starring Patrick McGoohan and Michael Craig

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Staff Nurse Rachel prepares to hand-rear two kittens for the next 12 weeks, hoping that by then an adoptive family will be found. New vet Aisling makes her first house call. An emergency call is made to the cat hospital after cat Jessie is hit by a truck

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The events of Febtuary 25, 2009, when Turkish Airlines Flight 1951 went down less than a mile from the runway at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport, breaking into three pieces on impact and killing nine passengers and crew and all three pilots. A faulty radio altimeter was the initial catalyst in a chain of errors that led to the horrific crash. Here, survivors tell their story of escaping from the wreckage of what should have been a normal commute home to Amsterdam

programme.title: Mr Harvey Lights a Candle
programme.desc: Timothy Spall stars as teacher Malcolm Harvey, who takes a class of unruly teenagers on the school trip from hell. The kids conspire to make a mockery of his plans and use a visit to Salisbury Cathedral as an excuse to cause chaos. As the trip unfolds, Mr Harvey is forced to explain the real reasons for this very private pilgrimage. Drama, co-starring Celia Imrie, Ben Miles and Natalie Press

programme.title: Live International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: South Africa v West Indies. Live coverage of the third and final T20 in the series from DP World Wanderers Stadium, Johannesburg. The sides last met in a T20 series in the West Indies in 2021, when the series ended in a 3-2 win for the Proteas. The series went to a thrilling fifth-match decider in St. George's which South Africa won by 25 runs after posting 168-4, before the home side could only make 143-9 in their 20 overs

programme.title: Live Women's Golf
programme.desc: The Augusta National Women's Amateur. Live coverage of day one from Augusta National Golf Club in Georgia, as Anna Davis looks to defend her title. The American finished with a score of 1-under-par to beat fellow American Latanna Stone and Sweden's Ingrid Lindblad by one stroke. This is just the fourth edition of the tournament, having first taken place in 2019 before being cancelled in 2020 due to the coronavirus pandemic
